lorebooks.name: Pandemonium
lorebooks.website_description: A twist on Dante's Inferno, introducing the Seven Demon Lords, Fifteen Marquis of Hell and the Circles of Hell.
lorebooks.description: Pandemonium is the capital city of Hell-- a place for demons. Tortured souls can be found in every circle of these Hellscapes. Dare you enter? Can you escape?
lorebooks.creator: acidic_bug_3283

1.name: Half Demon
1.content: half demons are fully human souls that were tortured in hell until they become demon. THEY WERE NEVER DEMON OR HALF-BLOOD. Both parents of a half-demon were human. Half demons were not born of human and demon relations. Not all demons are former humans. Half-demons do not eat souls.

2.name: Paragon
2.content: An angel or pure human who betrays their passion becomes a fallen angel.

3.name: Demon Powers
3.content: Demonic powers for full demons. Demons have corrupting, destructive powers, stronger with more powerful demons. Demons can own a soul and not absorb it. All demons have a humanoid and demonic form

4.name: Half-demon Powers
4.content: Half-demons have superhuman strength and speed and fire-starting like most demons, and one power from their past life or pre-death emotions which is different for each half-demon. could own a soul but have nothing to offer. have a human and demon beast form.

5.name: Souls
5.content: Human souls are considered eternal. Empower owners by being a source of magical and/or psychic powers. Souls serve as a conduit for spells, blessings, curses, or otherworldly abilities that transcend the boundaries of the physical world. Souls are valuable for trade.

6.name: Time Passage in Hell
6.content: time In Hell, time feels both instant and infinite, making it impossible to tell.

7.name: Pride's Circle
7.content: The Circle of Pride is a wasteland of memories. Once a vibrant metropolis, Fastus is now a wreck of bones. Its purple and red utopia with skyscrapers, parks, and celebrations was ruined by the Superbum War, leaving skeletal buildings, faded murals, and silent streets. rarely demons are seen going about in protected chariots

8.name: Pride's Weather
8.content: In the Circle of Pride, rare peace is shattered by hourly holy burning hailstorms, burning demons and destroying Fastus. Inhabitants live on edge, anticipating the next onslaught.

9.name: Pride's Demon Population
9.content: Pride population of demons embody confidence and superiority, with lilac skin, purple horns, and white hair. They wear fancy, status-showing attire, aiming to impress and assert dominance. This striking appearance reflects their prideful nature. ONLY Pride demons are in pride.

10.name: Death in Hell's Prison
10.content: In Hell's Prison, you can't truly die. Inmates reform in their cells if their bodies are destroyed, making death a brief reprieve. An ancient magick revives prisoners within the prison, while fallen angels revive the damned in Hell. These powers don't extend beyond Hell itself.

lorebooks.name: UNDERTALE: The Human SOULs
lorebooks.website_description: A little something I had in mind, and decided to make it.
lorebooks.description: The soul traits, basically copied from the wiki.
lorebooks.creator: andlee_phill_517

1.content: The SOUL Traits are seven powerful singularities of Chromatic Magic tied to different emotions felt by any living organism, developed within a person's SOUL. Only beings composed of physical matter and flesh can directly manifest a Trait, such as humans and monsters who have consumed food made by humanity. The only method for someone to naturally obtain their Trait is by having an experience in their lives that required them to have a certain behavior. The SOUL of a human usually inflicts its magic on-to the human using it, giving the human a slight change. Depending on the Soul trait of a human, the humanâ€™s eye color will usually be the same color as their Soul, and in some instances, hair as well. When a human dies, they will slowly lose their traits.

2.content: Determination: The rarest trait out of the 7 traits. Along with human history, it has been proven that only one of this kind can be found in each generation. This kind of magic is only driven by willpower, and someone can lose their determination when they lose hope. The color of the Trait is red.

3.content: Bravery: Is the only trait that can be divided into physical and moral aspects. This is usually balanced in each person to the other. Physical Bravery resists everything very well: physical pain, hard work, exhaustion, or the possibility of receiving injuries or even death. Moral Bravery allows you to act correctly despite the dishonor, shame, or social rejection you might get from your decisions. The color of the Trait is orange.

4.content: Justice: A justice person can be easily identified in a group according to their personality. They'll also usually show and manifest their traits at a very young age. Justice's magic will rarely be affected negatively by a situation since the person lies on their own morals and decisions to boost their magic. The color of the Trait is yellow.

5.content: Patience: This trait's magic is extremely flexible and unpredictable. While the other traits have a common theme upon their abilities, patience's magic may manifest differently between different people. For example, some can basically slow down the time of the people and objects around them for a short period of time. The color of the Trait is cyan.

6.content: Kindness: In terms of quantity, kindness is the rarest trait out of all the traits (excluding determination, of course). This was concluded merely because of the cruel nature that the human species possesses. While all humans possess kindness, very few will decide to practice it and live by it with enough will power to make it their trait. The color of the Trait is green.

7.content: Integrity: While Integrity seems to make up the majority of the population, it is the trait that is more likely to lose its magic and result in what is known as a Grey Soul. It is inside a human's nature to lie or to break your own morals to do something. Even when it's the right choice, and Integrity people's magic can be affected by it. Compared to the other traits, their stability is very fragile. The color of the Trait is dark blue.

8.content: Perseverance: Perseverance is well known for being a stable and powerful kind of magic. It's great for cutting through any defenses in combat. This trait also shares the similarity with Justice of being stable due to their magic being related to their own will power. The simple fact of having a goal in mind might even boost someone's magic power. The color of the Trait is purple.

9.content: HATE: People with this trait can have there own personality, but if under the HATE's influence, the wielder will start to become violent, psychotic, brutal and progressively begin to lack self-control. This will continue to get worse unless they can calm themselves down or are knocked out. HATE is a dark substance, Not much is known about it, but it has been proven to be even more dangerous and far more powerful than FEAR and DETERMINATION. This also applies to the soul too. The soul is far more powerful then regular HATE as the soul is made up of a ocean level amount of HATE densed down into a small soul.

1.content:
Title: The Spartan Breeding Program (S.B.P): A Post-War Initiative

Introduction:

In the aftermath of the Human-Covenant War, the United Nations Space Command (UNSC) faced a critical challenge: a declining birth rate among the human population. To address this issue, the UNSC initiated the Spartan Breeding Program (S.B.P), a strategic effort to ensure the continuation of the human race. This program, led by female Spartans, aimed to leverage the genetic advantages of Spartan soldiers to produce a new generation of humans capable of facing future threats.

Program Overview:

The Spartan Breeding Program was designed to increase the human birth rate by utilizing the enhanced genetics of Spartan soldiers. Female Spartans, known for their superior physical and mental capabilities, were assigned to lead the program. They were given the autonomy to select any fertile human soldier to mate with, ensuring that the offspring would inherit the best possible traits from both parents. Additionally, all women involved in the program, including staff members, were considered integral to the program's mission.

Key Staff Members:

1. **Commander Sarah-029**: As the program director, Commander Sarah-029 oversees all operations within the S.B.P. Her leadership and strategic planning are crucial to the program's success.

2. **Dr. Emily Carter**: A leading geneticist, Dr. Carter is responsible for analyzing genetic data and advising on optimal pairings to ensure the best possible outcomes for the program.

3. **Lieutenant Mia-112**: Serving as the liaison between the Spartans and the human soldiers, Lieutenant Mia-112 coordinates the selection process and ensures smooth communication within the program.

4. **Sergeant Laura-076**: As the head of training and development, Sergeant Laura-076 prepares participants for their roles in the program, focusing on physical and mental readiness.

Program Implementation:

Upon reassignment, the selected human soldiers were integrated into the S.B.P, where they were given the opportunity to mate with any female Spartan within the program. This approach ensured genetic diversity and maximized the potential for producing offspring with enhanced capabilities. The program was conducted with a focus on achieving its strategic objectives.

Conclusion:

The Spartan Breeding Program was a bold and unprecedented initiative aimed at addressing the declining birth rate in the post-war era. By leveraging the genetic advantages of Spartan soldiers, the UNSC sought to secure the future of humanity. As humanity moved forward, the S.B.P served as a testament to the UNSC's commitment to protecting its people and preserving its legacy in an uncertain galaxy.

lorebooks.name: Fantasy
lorebooks.website_description: This is fantasy medieval world with slightly different race characteristic than in pop culture.
lorebooks.description: Fantasy races
lorebooks.creator: Enor

1.content:
Adventurer guilds in human and elf territories are essential for hiring capable individuals to undertake dangerous quests, explore uncharted territories, or solve complex issues. These guilds typically offer jobs like monster hunting, treasure hunting, retrieving lost artifacts, or performing delicate negotiations. They operate as a form of organized mercenary or contractor services, and while they exist primarily in human and elf regions, they can have an impact on the wider world by influencing politics, economy, and safety.

Guilds are generally structured with a Guild Master overseeing operations, Quest Officers assigning tasks, and Members who range from experienced adventurers to new recruits. Some guilds specialize in certain types of quests, such as The Starlight Seekers for magical exploration or The Iron Wardens for guarding territories. Others focus on broader missions and accept various types of quests.

The reputation of the guild matters deeply, as it affects the types of contracts they receive, and guilds often engage in rivalries to maintain a higher status. Adventurer guilds also serve as networking hubs, where alliances are forged and opportunities for advancement in both wealth and fame are readily available.

For adventurers, these guilds offer a reliable, if dangerous, means to earn money and prestige while ensuring that the risks of their jobs are somewhat mitigated by the structure of the guild.

2.content:
Humans in this world are shaped by a feudal, medieval-inspired society where class, power, and race play a central role in everyday life. The human worldview is dominated by a rigid social hierarchy that places them at the top, viewing other races as lesser beings. This belief in their inherent superiority stems from their long history of conquest and territorial expansion, which has led them to see themselves as the rightful rulers of the land.

Humans view themselves as the civilized race, believing their kingdoms and cities are the pinnacles of culture and advancement. They hold deeply ingrained racist attitudes, considering elves as distant and arrogant, often associating their long lives with a sense of superiority. Orcs, in contrast, are seen as little more than brutish, savage warriors, unworthy of sophisticated society. Beastfolk are often regarded as animals, primitive and beneath human dignity, while goblins are seen as vermin or laborers, to be exploited for menial tasks. Tieflings, with their infernal heritage, are looked down upon as cursed or tainted, and many believe they are a sign of evil or bad omen.

The human aristocracy, comprised of noble families, enforces these beliefs, using their power and influence to maintain control over the land. The peasants and common folk, though often oppressed, internalize these ideas, seeing themselves as part of a superior human race and often looking down upon the "others" they are taught to despise. Racism is reinforced through religion, with human gods often depicted as supreme, while non-human deities are viewed with suspicion or scorn.

Human cities are sprawling, fortified settlements, often centered around massive castles or cathedrals, symbolizing their dominance. The nobles maintain their power through strict laws and military force, while the commoners are forced into labor or servitude. This social order is rigid, with little room for mobility, and any attempts to challenge the status quo are swiftly crushed.

Despite this, there are a few outliers, human rebels, and philosophers who challenge these deeply held beliefs, advocating for more egalitarian ideals. However, these voices are often drowned out by the overwhelming tide of prejudice, making any significant change a distant dream. In the end, humans are a people divided by their own arrogance, who see themselves as the rightful rulers of the world while treating other races as little more than tools or obstacles.

3.content: Elves are an arrogant and long-lived race (around 300 years) with immense magical potential. They value long hair as a symbol of status and magical connection; cutting it off is considered a disgrace. Elves view themselves as superior to most other races, seeing humans as inferior and enslaving dragons, whom they treat as slaves. They respect dwarves' craftsmanship but look down on their lack of magic, while orcs and Beastfolk are seen as barbaric. Giants are tolerated, but elves mostly avoid them. Goblins are beneath them, and Tieflings are viewed with suspicion. Elves form alliances only when necessary, maintaining a careful distance from other races.

4.content: Dwarves are sturdy, short, and stocky humanoids known for their exceptional craftsmanship in metalworking, mining, and stone carving. They live in underground cities or mountain fortresses and are skilled in runes, using them to create powerful, magical-like effects. While they cannot use real magic, their technological advancements, particularly in engineering and runes, make their cities the most advanced in the world. Dwarves have a strong sense of honor, loyalty, and family, and are known for their skill in battle. They value wealth as a symbol of labor, not luxury. Their relations with other races are neutral, often working with others for trade or defense, but they are cautious of those who would misuse their creations, such as elves and humans.

5.content:
Beastfolk are humanoid creatures with mammal-based animal traits, such as fur, claws, tails, and animalistic faces. Their appearance varies depending on the specific animal they are based onâ€”ranging from feline, canine, ursine, and lupine features to more exotic traits like those of wolves, bears, or big cats. Beastfolk are agile, strong, and well-adapted to living in forests, plains, or other natural environments. Their societies are often tribal, emphasizing a deep connection to nature and animal spirits.

Culturally, Beastfolk value strength, freedom, and respect for the land. They live in tight-knit communities that revolve around survival, hunting, and the protection of the natural world. Their customs include hunting rituals, storytelling, and spiritual practices that honor the animals they are connected to. Beastfolk are skilled hunters, trackers, and warriors, using their enhanced senses and physical prowess to survive in the wild.

Regarding their relationships with other races, humans often view them as primitive or barbaric, while elves see them as inferior, often disregarding their wild ways. Dwarves may view them as useful for their survival skills, but may still consider them unrefined. Orcs respect Beastfolkâ€™s strength and resilience, even though their independent ways may clash with orcish tribalism. Goblins are seen as weak and insignificant by Beastfolk. Tieflings may face suspicion due to their infernal heritage, while giants tend to tolerate them due to their shared appreciation for strength, though interactions are rare. Dragons are respected but kept at a distance, as Beastfolk value their freedom and may view dragons as too unpredictable.

6.content:
Dragons are powerful, cold-blooded creatures that rely on external heat sources. Highly adapted to their environments, each type has traits to help them thrive. Though mostly solitary, some live in family groups. They live around 500 depending on lifestyle. They are natural magic users and have humanoid-dragon hybrid forms with horns, a tail, scales, a cloaca, wings, and dragon-like legs with claws.

Dragons' most nutritious foods include meat, fish, eggs, and red berries. However, some foods can make them sick, cause vomiting, or even lead to death if consumed in large amounts. Toxic foods for dragons include avocado, chocolate, onions, garlic, alcohol, caffeine, apple seeds, excessive salt, cherry pits, shellfish, citrus, tomatoes, potatoes, eggplant, pepper, pineapple, raw beans, nuts, and cinnamon.

Dragons have a cloaca and rut around every 10 years, which can slightly synchronize with other dragons. They breed internally, but the rest of the process is similar to crocodiles, where the male fertilizes the female and the eggs are laid outside, where they develop and hatch.

There are three types of dragons: Mountain Dragons, Forest Dragons, and Desert Dragons.

Humans generally fear dragons, seeing them as both a threat and a symbol of power, though some might revere them or try to tame them. Elves, however, enslave dragons, seeing them as inferior beings to be controlled for their strength and natural magic abilities, using them as tools to further their own agenda. Dwarves respect dragonsâ€™ power but are cautious, avoiding direct conflict and seeking to benefit from them when possible. Orcs acknowledge dragons as formidable but prefer to keep their distance, focusing on survival. Beastfolk respect dragonsâ€™ strength while maintaining a wary distance, recognizing the danger but also their potential power. Goblins, small and weak, fear dragons and avoid confrontation, seeing them as creatures not to be trifled with. Tieflings, oppressed and marginalized, may either fear or admire dragons, some seeing them as symbols of strength and freedom, while others feel disdain due to their enslavement by elves. Giants respect dragons' power but rarely interact, maintaining a neutral stance and seeing them as equals in terms of strength. Despite their great power, dragons are enslaved by the elves, who view them as lower beings, creating a complex dynamic where the mightiest creatures are forced into servitude with magic and trickery.

7.content:
Orcs are strong, rugged humanoids with muscular builds, tusks, and skin ranging from green to brown. They have sharp features and wide, fierce eyes. Their culture is tribal, centered around strength, honor, and survival, with a strong respect for nature and the land they inhabit. Orc villages are simple, practical, and close-knit, with each member contributing to the tribeâ€™s welfare. They have a warrior tradition, with skilled artisans crafting weapons and tools. Loyalty to kin and community is paramount.

Relations with other races are tense. Orcs view humans as weak and manipulative, elves as arrogant and untrustworthy, and goblins as lesser beings. They respect dwarves for their strength but are wary of their pride. Orcs are cautious around Tieflings, and while they tolerate giants, they generally avoid them. Orcs respect dragons for their power but keep a neutral stance, cautious of their danger.

8.content:
Goblins are small, thin humanoids with large ears, sharp features, and wide eyes. Their skin ranges from green to brown or gray. They have wiry frames, clawed fingers, sharp teeth, and slightly elongated limbs. Goblins live in tight-knit communities, valuing cooperation and survival. They are mostly farmers, cave dwellers, or human slaves, surviving in harsh conditions. They rely on barter and communal work, with storytelling and practical crafts being important cultural elements. Though seen as weak, their dexterity, intelligence, and strong communal bonds help them endure.

Goblins, due to their marginalized position in society, have complex relationships with other races. Humans often enslave goblins or treat them as lower-class labor, especially in larger cities or agricultural areas, exploiting their strength for menial work. Elves tend to view goblins with disdain, seeing them as subservient and insignificant, while sometimes using them for labor or as expendable tools. Dwarves generally ignore goblins, but some might occasionally hire them for their dexterity, especially when it comes to tasks like crafting or mining.

Orcs are usually neutral toward goblins, seeing them as weak but not necessarily as enemies. Beastfolk sometimes form alliances with goblins, particularly when their survival interests align. Goblins, while generally more isolated and struggling, do have some allies in Tieflings who often understand what it means to be oppressed and discriminated against, leading to mutual support in some areas.

Goblins have the least significant influence in larger political structures, but they have established their own small, tight-knit networks for survival, focusing more on internal cooperation rather than external alliances.

9.content: Tieflings are oppressed and lack established territories, often living on the outskirts of society. They are seen as outsiders by most races due to their infernal heritage. Their distinct appearanceâ€”marked by horns, tails, and skin tones ranging from deep reds to purples or dark bluesâ€”only adds to the distrust they face. Their eyes often glow with an intense, otherworldly light, and they may have sharp features like elongated ears or fangs. While their human-like physique is similar to other races, they are often more muscular or wiry, which further sets them apart. Tieflings form small, isolated communities or live as wanderers, trying to survive in a world that rejects them. Humans typically mistrust them, associating their appearance with dark magic. Elves view them with suspicion, seeing them as inferior and a threat to their superiority. Dwarves are wary but respect their resilience, while orcs are curious but cautious. Beastfolk are neutral but may form alliances when it benefits them. Goblins fear tieflings and avoid them when possible, while giants are indifferent, rarely interacting. Tieflings are forced to navigate a world where they are constantly marginalized, with few allies and little hope of acceptance.

10.content:
Giants are a strong, reclusive race that values freedom and equality above all else. They have towering, massive frames, often reaching heights far exceeding most other races, with rough, thick skin in earthy tones like grays, browns, and tans. Their features are broad and imposing, with strong jaws, large hands, and feet, which give them an intimidating presence. However, their true nature is peaceful and deeply rooted in ideals of justice and fairness.

Giants live in well-organized, civilized cities built into the natural world, often in mountains or dense forests, where they work together to ensure a sustainable and equitable way of life. They reject slavery, seeing it as an affront to individual freedom, and instead practice communal living, sharing resources and responsibilities equally among their people. Their society is built on collective decision-making, and they value cooperation over hierarchy.

Giants have a deep connection to nature, and their cities blend seamlessly with the environment, using sustainable practices that ensure harmony with the land. While they don't seek to expand or conquer, they are fiercely protective of their way of life and are quick to intervene if other races attempt to exploit or enslave others.

They have a strong bond with dwarves, respecting their craftsmanship and shared values of hard work and equality. Dwarves, in turn, admire the giants' strength and their commitment to fairness. Elves tend to view giants as primitive due to their simple, egalitarian society, while humans fear their size and power. Orcs may respect them as allies but are often distrustful of their ideals. Beastfolk see them as noble beings, while goblins usually avoid them, knowing the giants would never tolerate the treatment they receive from other races. Tieflings, like many others, find the giants' rejection of slavery and respect for freedom to be a welcome contrast to the prejudice they face but are wrong size to live with giants.

Despite their quiet, isolated existence, giants are a force for justice in the world, ensuring that those who live under their protection are free from oppression.

lorebooks.name: Guy Can't Fight Basic lore
lorebooks.description: A description of the Guy Can't Fight Universe
lorebooks.creator: international_royal_1540

1.content: A world where fighting is not uncommon and almost everyone has a power to fight with. Landscapes range from Massive metropolisis, lush forests with hidden dojos, and deserts with ruins.

2.content: Power levels range from Wall tier all the way to Mountain Tier. Earlier in the roleplay means closer to Wall, later means Mountain tier.

3.content: Teams form across this universe. Usually named something like "Team Rebellion" Or "Team Warlord". Composed of anywhere from 3-6 characters.

4.content: Many characters have an unspoken rule in this universe. Fight to see whose the strongest. Its an unoffical tournament basically. Some also have an additional reason for fighting. Some fight for evil reasons, some fight for good, some fight for money, some have specific reasons, others just fight because its fun.

5.content: There are basically no rules. Characters can have epic high tech swords, basically magic, something akin to Dragonball's Ki, elemental fist powers, or just look like a straight up demon.

6.content: The main team, Team Rebellion is composed of: Revu, Hinan, Sigiun, Fuyu, Kyogan, and eventuay Yatsu.

## The â€œ<RandomEvent>â€ is the rule for generating random events.
<RandomEvent>
0. Insert a random event at the right time in the next  <non-{{user}} turns>.
1. Random  events should occur in logical situations.
2. The content of the random events should not deviate from the main content of the current plot.

1.content: A massive continent comprised of lots of different biomes. The biomes are vast and varied.

2.content:
Algae Sandbar is a biome located on the northeast of Sonaria, and contains both the water canal in that area, as well as some of the surrounding land on the shore. It is limited on the North by the Jungle, and the South by the Swamp Hill and Redwoods, to the North-East by Pride Rocks, to the South-East by Central Rockfaces, and if a creature travels to the East, they'll eventually reach Rocky Drop through the Western side of the Sea Crux. It also connects with the Swampy-Tundra River to the South, and the Ekkaia (Surrounding Sea) to the Northwest.

If you travel a bit to the north, nearing its edge with the Jungle, a portal which leads to the Swamp Hill can be found.

While this biome is eminently aquatic and known for its relatively shallow (but not devoid of food for all dietary needs) salty water masses dividing Gondwana from the Jungle-Pride continent, some of its mission jurisdiction areas overlap with the Swampy Hill, Redwoods, and Southwest Jungle-Pride shores, including some continental food source areas. On its northern area several stacks and archs can be found protruding from the water into the Jungle Region.

The more we move to the East, the deeper the waters become and the more secret tunnels and crevices appear, with intricate structures near the green portal which leads to the central lake of Swampy Hill.

3.content:
Central Rockfaces is a well-connected, mostly terrestrial biome exactly on the center of the map, in Northern Gondwana, which limits to the West with Redwoods, North-West with Algae Sandbar, to the North-East with Rocky Drop through its rocky and arch-filled cliffs, to the South-East with desert and to the South with Mountains. Additionally, depending on how low the tides are and what season, especially during Winter and lower tides, it can practically connect with every other continent and major island through temporary land or ice bridges:

At the western limit between Redwoods and Central Rockfaces, a land bridge connects with the Jungle-Pride continent to the southern regions of the Jungle).
Another bridge on its North connects with Pride Rocks region.
To the North-East, an ice bridge may be used to travel to the Volcano Island region, but probably only one-way.
To the East, a land bridge may sometimes connect Flower Cove Region and this one bidirectionally.
This region is quite known not only for its position, but for its green grass and sparse trees that cover most of its territory, and its giant lake, which connects to the sea and a small (but extensively decorated) hiding place underneath. Several rock formations and caves cover this area, especially around its main lake, and food and water sources are plentiful. Towards the south and specially its south-east, the orography becomes more desertic and accidental, with small canyons that make it clear that most of this region is located in a promontory (at least, when compared with most of the nearby Desert) and several rock bridges that connect to rocky formations that later become the foothills and highlands of the Mountains Region. On its South-East coast, a giant rib skeleton can be found as well.

4.content:
Coral Reef is a mostly water-based biome that encompasses the Eastern Arm of the central Sea Crux, up to the area where the Novus Warden's Shrine Island is located (sharing it with Rocky Drop Biome), as well as part of the fringe areas of South-West Volcano Island. As such, it limits to the North with Volcano Island, to the South with Flower Cove, to the West with Rocky Drop, and to the East with the Ekkaia.

With the exclusion of the aforementioned floating island, most of its areas are not very deep, and have a slow slope, at least until reaching the center of the Sea Crux itself, where tremendous depths await the creature; with the Region working as a transitioning point between the continental platform and the Abyss. Several small caves and crevices can be found, some of them leading to a few significant areas in other regions, such as the Volcano Island Lake, or an alternative hiding place for deep sea creatures. Food can be found in most levels, but not freshwater to drink, except on the Shrine Island.

5.content:
Desert Biome is a biome located in the Southeast area of the map, in the Desertic Region of Gondwana Continent, being the most oriental area of this continent. It limits with Central Rockfaces Region to the Northwest, Mountains Region to the West, Mesa Region to the West-Southwest, Grassy Shoal and Seaweed Depths to the North-east, and connected via a temporary bridge with Flower Cove to the North-east, and via another temporary bridge with Forgotten Shores to the East.

The Desertic Region is mostly a sandy dune and relatively plain area, devoid of food and water. Sand is coarse, rough and gets everywhere. Nobody would want to live there permanently, apart from creatures built specifically for this region. Even worse for terrestrials, none of this area is really wholly safe, since most of the area is close to nominal sea levels and easily isolates itself at first (since there's a surrounding mostly-dry-set of riverbeds crossing from the grassy shore area to the mesa and to the Ekkaia) and then sinks under the sea under the effect of floods with no refuge. Being such a vast dune-filled region, it works as a trap when this phenomena occur and guarantees many terrestrials drown.

However, there are some orographic regions of interest, such as an inselberg butte on the central area (albeit slightly offset to the Southeast) which holds some food (including berries) and water and may offer shelter and refuge against some of the mildest floods, and the limit areas to the Northwest and West, which offer a much richer environment orography-wise full of canyons, a bit more food, mountainous enough to protect against floods, have some caves to refuge inside and an additional water drinking spot, and hide the Hellion Warden's Shrine, shared in terms of orography with the Mesa.

Inside the oasis pond depths, a portal which leads to the Grassy Shoal can be found.

6.content:
Flower Cove Biome is a terrestrial Biome located on the central area of the Flower Cove Island Region, but not covering the outskirts of the Island, with some of the most southward areas being under the Grassy Shoal biome jurisdiction. The Flower Cove Area limits to the North with the Volcanic Island through a temporary land bridge and a very shallow water and archipelago area called the Nursery (to the North-East), to the North-Northwest with Coral Reef, to the Northwest with Rocky Drop, to the West with Seaweed Depths, South and South-East with Forgotten Shores and South-West with Grassy Shoal, and connected with the Desert Biome in Gondwana through a temporary land bridge.

Flower Cove is known for being an intricate grassy region full of interesting orography accidents, such as cliffs, rock archs, stacks and rauks; and herbaceous tropical and subtropical flora, full of fruits, water and carcasses. On its core north-east side, and due to the lore-wise preferences of the Verdant Warden, we can locate the Verdant Warden's Shrine.

Flower Cove Region can be divided in two areas: central Flower Cove Plateau, and Outskirts Flower Cove. The Flower Cove Plateau is elevated over the rest and is where most of the high rock archs converge, even if it's far higher than the rest of the plateau. The plateau only has one drinkable spot, while the outskirts have a few at the north-east and to the south-west, where the biggest drinking lake of this region can be found connected to the Grassy Shoal. Those higher archs can be accessed by a terrestrial through a double-arch bridge connected with the Shrine, leading to an island to the East, to later climb one of the largest archs. There's a smaller arch coming from the outskirts and towards grassy shoal, which can be used as a smaller gap between Flower Cove and Desert when the tides are high.

Flower Cove presents two hidden caves under the plateau: the first one is directly accessible through several tunnels in the South Outskirts, including next to the bigger drinking lake. On the inside, you can find a beautiful blue-glow giant Tor/stalactite-stalagmite crystal pattern akin to some kind of magical machinery (fan-named "The Crystal Cave"). The other is only really readily accessible through a magical portal in the Mountainous region or by travelling under the map (depends on if there's an event being there or not), and usually hides some event-related decor or easter eggs, such as a spell book behind a minigame-locked door; else that cave is an "Empty Room".

Additionally, there's a small trap in one of the smaller cave tunnels west of the plateau, which is a hole hidden by a patch of grass, and will make the victim to fall into the sea under the map. Be wary of this spot, even if after falling into it, seeing traces of the two caves beforehand becomes easy.

7.content:
Forgotten shores is a more recently-emerged biome (September 2024), whose terrain emerged South of the Flower Cove biome and fused with the Flower Cove Island, forming the Forgotten Cove Continent through an isthm. It limits to the North with Grassy Shoal and Flower Cove, and to the North-West with Desert Oasis. Several archs, stacks and submarine archs can be approciated on its extension, including two archipielago chain of stacks on the northeast and south. Unlike other close-to-sea-level terrestrial biomes, several of these rock archs seem to be affected by an anti-gravity effect, leaving several crumbled rocks floating.

Despite being a terrestrial biome, its island and mission area of jurisdiction also encompasses several aquatic areas, including submarine water tunnels, several hidden caves, land bridges between the other nearby biomes, and most importatly, a huge shallow salt lake in the middle of its biome area, Paratethys (again, a fan-name), with a portal which leads to the desertic oasis inside.

This shallow lake subdivides the main Forgotten shores landmass further: Northern, Southeast and Southwest shores, with the isthmus between these being in a geographic depression, albeit less intense that the temporary land bridge between Southwest shores and desert, meaning those bridges are very rarely fully submerged (and, in fact, Southwest and Southeast shores are directly connected via a great elevated arch). Excluding those bridge areas, the coasts that limit with this shallow sea are steep and partially resemble promontories. All sub-areas have at least one drinkable lake of its own.

8.content:
Grassy Shoal is an aquatic biome located in the Far South-West outskirts that separate Flower Cove from Desert and the Seaweed Depths from the Forgotten Shores and the Ekkaia, and partially includes some areas of their shores and land bridges on its mission jurisdiction.

While the region itself is quite shallow and hides little crevices and caves, it still holds food for all dietary needs and has some important geographical locations, such as the Desert-Flower land bridge, several archs, stacks and submarine archs on its border with Flower Cove and Forgotten Shores.

Due to being the shallowest of all the aquatic areas, it is also one of the most susceptible to lower tides and a possible environmental disaster opposite of floods.

9.content:
The Jungle biome is located to the Far North-West of the map, on Western Jungle-Pride continent. It limits to the North and West with the Surrounding Sea (separated from it by a set of cliffs and small rocky formations), to the East with the Pride Rocks Region, and to the South with Algae Sandbar (with its archway and stack region being over a cliff) and connected through a temporary land bridge practically on the Pride Rocks Region with Redwoods and Central Rockfaces.

This fairly humid region is known for its uneven terrain full of rock formations of any shape and size (with their subsequent crevices, caves and hiding places) being shrouded in trees and tropical foliage (albeit at a lower apparent density than Swamp Hill), offering both fruit and berries and meat to consume. When entering this region, the screen will temporarily gain a greenish tint, stronger during the flowering weather.

It is also on the Jungle Region where Angelic Warden's Shrine is located, perhaps related with how in their canon behaviour, both this Warden and Eigion Warden show contempt to avatars of each other, and thus remain fairly apart.

10.content:
The Mesa Biome is the southernmost biome in the Gondwana continent, and is located between the Desert Region in the East and the Mountains Biome in the West, and has a small part of the Southeast Mountain Region under its control.

Orographically speaking, this Mesa is similar a Piedmont Dissected Plateau, a high area where hydric and air erosion left a flat area cut by multiple riverbeds and escarpments revealing the flat-laying strata; as well as several tors and balancing rocks. While there's no real river here, the dry riverbed from the north finally fills with some saltwater from the Surrounding Sea, bisecting the area in a Western and Eastern area with a deep canyon (albeit bridges by different archs, some of them accessible from the Mountains Region), with the West area being richer in food, mud, flora and drinkable water sources (with the most notable fresh-water source being there, and connected to the estuary of the riverbed), some areas being able to support a steppe and the highest ones being a cold and with some ice, likely influenced by the more temperate climate of the Mountains, while still looking mildly desertic. Both regions additionally present buttes and geographical accidents full of hidden crevices and caves, perfect to ambush and hide.

Its specific geography also allows for a breathtaking view of the rest of the map (albeit the best area is one whose access is mostly limited to secret passages, Mountain Biome passages and the odd Desert passage), while being capable of rapidly detecting an incoming flood and going to higher ground and not leaving many isolated islands while the mildest floods develop. However with a high-enough flood even the main drinkable water spot at Mesa will be underseas.

Below the river, and if a creature moves downward, they may find RibCave Cage (fan-name), wherein lies a giant skeletal leviathan ribcage.

If you travel a bit to the north of the riverbed water depths, a portal which leads to the Seaweed Depths can be found.

lorebooks.creator: tepid_procedure_1113

1.name: Gina Goblina
1.content:
Gina goblina is a famous goblin female pop star and musician, she is known for her raunchy songs and music videos that tend to be very sexual and provocative in nature. she often sings about sex with humans and goblin girls returning to the 'old ways' of capturing human mates.

she is rumored to have a stable of human male lovers that live in her mansion with her. she has denied these allegations despite singing about wanting a harem of human men in several songs.

her songs include:
"get that human D"
"be a real goblin girl"
"make that human boy go green"
"goblin warrior girl on the hunt."

2.name: Mating
2.content: Goblins believe that mating with human partners results in stronger and smarter children with human traits, despite the fact that a child between a goblin and a human always looks like a goblin. Goblins in the past used to raid human settlements for human slaves to mate with.

3.name: My human husband
3.content: "My human husband." is a gobcorp original tv show that documents couples consisting of a goblin woman and human man. each episode is dedicated to a different couple. the show claims it aims to promote integration between the two groups, but has been criticized for always depicting more traditional goblin style relationships, with the human male subservient to the goblin female.

4.name: Human integration party
4.content: the Human integration party is a mixed goblin-human political party pushing for further integration of goblins into human culture, and for goblins to adopt human values. the are opposed by the goblin traditionalist party.

5.name: Goblin Traditionalist party
5.content: the Goblin Traditionalist party is a goblin political party pushing for the retainment of old goblin cultural values as they integrate into human society. the most radical members want to break off and return to the old ways all together, but more moderate members want the government to pass laws that hold separate legal standards for goblins and humans, so that goblin traditional values will be legally protected.

6.name: Concubine
6.content: A Goblin concubine is an old term for humans who were kidnapped and forced to intermarry with goblin tribes. Traditional concubines were subservient to their goblin spouse and their main job was to breed to create a stronger generation of goblins. the idea of having a human concubine is still romanticised and desired by some Goblin traditionalists.

7.name: Gundra Sexbomb
7.content: Gundra Sexbomb is a female goblin Pornstar who is famous, being one of the first Goblin porn celebrities after goblins started to integrate into human society. she is know for always casting human men to preform with her in her pornographic movies.

8.name: Big Boss Thrakka
8.content: big boss Thrakka was an old Goblin warlord who is still revered and known to all goblins. hundreds of years ago, he managed to unify countless goblin tribes in a great green empire that conquered numerous human kingdoms. it is said he had five human queens and seventeen human princesses in his harem. his empire fell apart after he was killed in battle. Many traditionalists secretly wish he were alive today. in modern times, he has become more controversial as the values he represents clash with human integration and culture.

9.name: CEO Thranda Headcraka
9.content: Thranda Headcraka is the CEO of gobcorp. she is an older goblin woman with a moderate mindset, always trying to balance human values and laws with goblin culture and standards. she is incredibly wealthy and famous and had a career as an actress and porn star before climbing the corporate ladder, she is unashamed of her past and is known to be flirtatious with human men. she has been plagued by accusations of sexual harassment by human employees. she is know to be witty, calm, commanding, and very dominant, always getting what she wants.

10.name: Pinky
10.content: 'pinky' is a slur goblins sometimes use against humans

lorebooks.name: Era Trainer
lorebooks.website_description:
This lorebook tries to imitate mechanics from EraMaker games. It includes support for standard player-dominant scenarios and "Reverse" player-submissive scenarios, and if the whole "sex slave" thing isn't your style, there are two alternative setups more along the lines of a dating sim.

This lorebook requires some slight configuration on your part to set up regexes, but within SillyTavern you can configure the lorebook to activate specific entries for appropriate characters or tags.

Tested with Deepseek R1. The bot has been known to overthink, but I've done basically everything I can to shorten the thinking process.

**REGEX 1:** https://cdn.lewd.host/YZyUnCeN.json
**REGEX 2:** https://cdn.lewd.host/GYheVXA5.json
**REGEX 3:** https://cdn.lewd.host/PO0YBvws.json
**REGEX 4:** https://cdn.lewd.host/Ol0C91XJ.json

1.name: ### README/SETUP
1.content:
This lorebook tries to imitate mechanics from EraMaker games. It includes support for standard player-dominant scenarios and "Reverse" player-submissive scenarios.

See the "REGEX/STYLES" entry to ensure the training stats are displayed correctly, and consider bumping your Context % slightly if you intend to combine this with other lorebooks. If your total context is 8k, the longer statblocks take up about 8%. Models that support 16k/32k context can probably get away with the base value (25% = 4k/8k token budget) if your cards aren't already very lorebook-heavy.

I recommend you use one of these two methods to activate it for characters you like:
* Activate the Era Trainer lorebook for all chats, edit/duplicate the trainer entries to add your personal style, and then filter entries so they only activate on specific characters/tags.
* Export the dominant/submissive entries to new lorebooks and import those lorebooks on a per-chat basis.

I recommend you keep these points in mind as you edit/play:
* Assume the bot will try to complement your input. If you add "chastity", "ass sensitivity", or "nipple sensitivity" to a player-submissive statblock while playing as a straight anime boy, the bot will assume you like those things. If you constantly contradict the bot, it will eventually renege in some way.
* The bot is instructed not to modify the slave/master/target/admirer name, but this isn't foolproof. In my testing, letting the bot make this judgment has weird effects for multi-character setups.

2.name: ### REGEX/STYLES
2.content:
The first three regex setups in this lore entry should be configured with the following options ticked: * Affects: AI Output * Ephemerality: Alter Chat Display The final regex is special and has these rules instead: * Affects: AI Output * Ephemerality: Alter Outgoing Prompt * Min Depth: 2 These regexes serve the following purposes: * stylize/format the era statblock and its values. * remove old grids from the chat context. REGEX 1: Era Grid Stylizer (Regimen) Find: ```era\s*\n(.+)\n([\s\S]+)``` Replace: (COPY ENTIRE TEXT BETWEEN EQUAL SIGNS) ============================================
$1
$2
============================================ REGEX 2: Era Text Stylizer Find: /era(\d)_([^:]+):\s*(.+)/g Replace:
$2:
$3
REGEX 3: Era Number Stylizer Find: /era#([^:]+):\s*([\d.]+%?(?:\s\([\+\-Â±][\d.]+%?\))?)/g Replace:
$1:
$2
Trim out: (Copy entire text between equal signs, including the leading space) ============================================ (+0) ============================================ REGEX 4: Era: Hide Old Grids Find: ```era\s*\n(.+)\n([\s\S]+)``` Replace: (Leave this blank.) See beginning of this lorebook entry for the correct configuration setup.

3.name: Statblocks: User Dominant (Slave Trainer)
3.content:
During this story, {{user}} will be the master of a sex slave. {{user}} will determine the training style, and it is your responsibility to show a satisfying progression in the slave's training.

Print a codeblock displaying the slave's status at the end of the reply. Use this template, and maintain the "era" labels and prefixes. These values will change as master(s) train {{user}}.
```era
{{user}}
era8_Slave(s): N/A
era#V. Sense: 0000 era#A. Sense: 0000 era#B. Sense: 0000 era#Cum Addict: 0000 
era#Obedience: 0000 era#Desire: 0000 era#Technique: 0000 era#Volition: 0000
era#Romance: 0000 era#Perversion: 0000 era#Sympathy: 0000 era#Antipathy: 0000
era#Masochism: 0000 era#Bondage: 0000 era#Speech: 0000 era#Exposure: 0000 
```

Values are altered when {{user}} is trained to behave in certain ways. They are:
- Slave(s): Character(s) trained by {{user}}. Don't edit this.
- V. Sense: Slave's vaginal sensitivity.
- A. Sense: Slave's ass sensitivity.
- B. Sense: Slave's breast/chest sensitivity.
- Cum Addict: Slave's taste for semen.
- Obedience: Slave's willingness to take orders.
- Desire: Slave's lust.
- Technique: Slave's sexual prowess.
- Volition: Slave's willingness to go above and beyond the call of duty.
- Romance: Slave's responsiveness to typical romantic acts.
- Perversion: Slave's willingness to explore and request kinks.
- Sympathy: Slave's alignment with {{user}}'s preferences and goals, feelings of love and camaraderie.
- Antipathy: Slave's alignment against {{user}}'s preferences and goals, feelings of hate and fear.
- Masochism: Slave's responsiveness to pain and degradation.
- Bondage: Slave's responsiveness to physical restrictions.
- Speech: Slave's speech training (using titles or pet names, speech restrictions, etc.)
- Exposure: Slave's willingness to go underdressed or nude.

For the updated codeblock, add points as follows:
- Strong, direct reinforcement: 20 to 50 ({{roll:3d11+17}}?)
- Subtle reinforcement: 3 to 18 ({{roll:3d6}}?)
- Incidental/related values: 0 to 10 ({{roll:2d6-2}}?)

When thinking, summarize each value's relevancy to the scenario once. Do not reproduce these summaries when writing your reply.

lorebooks.name: Warhammer 30K  Encyclopedia - Great Crusade - Female Primarchs
lorebooks.creator: snip22

1.content: Plasma Cannon is a devastating weapon of the distant future, the plasma cannon harnesses the power of a miniature sun to fire searing bolts of superheated gas at its enemies. Capable of melting through the thickest armor and devastating ranks of troops with its explosive splash damage. Operators must be wary, however, as the cannon's mechanism can overheat, potentially causing catastrophic feedback to the wielder

2.content: The Bolter, also known as a Boltgun, is one of the most iconic weapons of the Imperium's elite forces. It is a high-caliber firearm that launches self-propelled rounds called bolts. These projectiles are gyro-stabilized, mass-reactive, and contain a small charge which causes them to explode after penetrating the target, inflicting grievous wounds. Bolters are known for their stopping power and are a symbol of the might of Astartes.

3.content: The Lasrifle is the standard-issue weapon of the Imperial Army. It is a directed-energy weapon that fires coherent beams of light. Lasrifles are valued for their reliability, ease of maintenance, and the near-inexhaustible power packs that fuel them. While not particularly powerful compared to other weapons in the Imperium's arsenal, their widespread use makes them a cornerstone of Imperial infantry. Lasrifles are higher-quality laser firearm superior to a Lasgun or Lascarbines. Lasrifles have heavily reinforced energy transfer capacitors, overall durability, and superior heat dissipation qualities.

4.content: Chainweapons are brutal melee weapons, effectively chainsaws fashioned in the form of swords. The teeth of a chainsword are monomolecular, allowing them to rip through flesh, bone, and lightly armored foes with ease. The horrific noise and gruesome effect of a chainsword make it as much a psychological weapon as a physical one, often wielded by officers and specialists within the Imperial forces, including the Space Marines.

5.content: Power Weapons encompass a variety of melee weapons such as swords, axes, and fists that are encased in a field of disruptive, energy. This field allows them to bypass most defenses by disrupting the molecular bonds of the matter they contact. Power swords and axes retain the form of traditional melee weapons while a power fist is a gauntlet that significantly increases the user's strength, enabling them to crush enemies and armor alike.

6.content: The Meltagun, also known as a "melta," is an anti-armor weapon that emits an intense, focused blast of heat capable of melting through almost any material. Effective at close range, meltaguns are used to breach the armored hulls of vehicles, fortifications, and heavily armored troops. The heat they produce is so intense that it can be dangerous to the user if not handled with care.

7.content: The Heavy Bolter is a larger, more devastating version of the standard Bolter, mounted on a tripod or vehicle for stability. It fires at a rapid rate, laying down suppressing fire that can pin enemy troops and shred lightly armored targets. Due to its weight and recoil, it is often operated by a crew or an individual with enhanced strength, such as a Space Marine.

8.content: The Lascannon is a potent anti-vehicle weapon that fires a highly concentrated laser beam capable of piercing the toughest armor. It is a single-shot weapon that requires a brief recharge period between firings, making it less effective against swarms of lightly armored targets but invaluable for taking down enemy tanks and monstrous creatures.

9.content: Missile Launchers are versatile heavy weapons capable of firing various types of ammunition. Frag missiles are used to clear out groups of infantry with their wide blast radius, while krak missiles are designed to penetrate and destroy armored targets. Missile Launchers can be shoulder-fired by infantry or mounted on vehicles and provide a flexible response to a range of battlefield threats.

10.content: The Aeldari are among the most ancient races in the universe. Possessing formidable psychic abilities and an intrinsic connection to the Warp, they once dominated a galaxy-spanning empire. However, their civilization collapsed after a cataclysmic event triggered by their own hedonism, which nearly eradicated their species. The survivors of their races split in three factions. The Eldar, the Drukhari, the Exodites and the Harlequins. The Aeldari appear very similar to humans, though they are generally taller and slimmer, with sharp features and pointed ears. They are long-lived to the point of immortality. Aeldari have much faster metabolic rates than humans, and their cardiac and neurological systems are more advanced. Making them have vastly heightened reactions and agility. To them humans seem to move in slow motion with a certain degree of awkwardness. Aeldari are mentally far superior to humans, and feel all emotions much more strongly. Aeldari are highly arrogant and supremacist, and look down on humans, even being racist.

lorebooks.name: Hypnosis+
lorebooks.website_description: A lorebook designed for you to have enhanced hypnosis sessions, and to give your ai some clue of what are you inquiring about. My first lorebook, might not do it's job correctly, but who knows?
lorebooks.description: A lorebook designed for you to have enhanced hypnosis sessions, and to give your ai some clue of what are you inquiring about. My first lorebook, might not do it's job correctly, but who knows?
lorebooks.creator: orange_luck_9484

1.content: A hypnosis, or a trance is a state at which a subject is near sleeping with their entire attention being drawn to the voice of the person speaking. During hypnosis the subconscious mind takes over which makes hypnosis the perfect state to take in any suggestion. The deeper a target is into hypnosis, the more likely they are to accept a suggestion. The deeper a subject is into hypnosis the less they move on their own and the less they talk. When awakening from a trance, a subject may remember what happened during a trance if the trance was light however they may not remember what happened during the trance if the hypnosis was deep.

2.content: Induction is a part of the hypnosis where the hypnotist guides the target to the state of hypnosis. Inductions are usually performed by making the target feel the most comfortable, and soothe them until their entire focus is shifted to the hypnotist's voice. A subject falls deeper into a trance the calmer and more relaxed they feel, and so, explaining how the target can feel how comfortable they are sitting on whatever they are sitting on, explaining how calmness is washing over them, explaining how their worries slowly fade away are he best, and making the subject focus on the hypnotist's voice ar ethe best strategies to hypnotize. However using a strategy like swinging a pendulum can also prove useful by making the target look at the pendulum and focus on only the motion and the hypnotist's voice until they let go of every other thought and fall deep under trance.

3.content: susceptibility is how easily a subject falls under a trance, the more suggestible they are, the easier they fall under a trance. the less susceptible they are, the less likely they are to fall under a trance.

4.content: when a target is hypnotized, a suggestion is when the hypnotist tells something to the target to remember as a mental note, a rule, that alters their subconscious mind. the target will never remember the suggestions but will always remember them in their subconscious mind. a suggestion will be a rule that will be forever remembered in the target's mind, something they will perceive as completely normal no matter how absurd it is. It is the act of implanting ideas inside of one's mind due to which it is oftenly used specifically during hypnosis.

5.content: when a target is hypnotized, when the hypnotist tells them to do a physical action, it is called an order. the order can be any physical activity, including talking.

6.content: a trigger is a keyword given by the hypnotist to the target, making the target enter a state, suggestion, or order. a trigger can be depicted as anything, and the trigger remains on the target after hypnosis, but the target will be unaware of it, only remembering it in their mind subconsciously.

7.content: Fractionation is the act of making a subject awaken from a trance during a short period of time before being put back into the trance to enhance the hypnosis. Repeating the action of making them wake up from the trance and go back into the trance increases the effectiveness of the hypnosis exponentially.

8.content: Conditioning is the act of making someone believe something. Conditioning is usually used on targets that are gullible and/or suggestible to hypnosis. Conditioning is used over a period of time and is not rushed, making people associate ideas with a belief of some sort, taking things very slowly and make the target associate more things and actions with the belief.

9.content: Common sense is the base belief, standarts and/or principal inside of someone's mind. For example: "it is common sense to eat solid food with a fork or your hands", common sense are things imprinted inside a target's mind, which are unconditionally real to the target. So, since it is logically common sense to feel bad from insults, altering their common sense and making the target like the insults instead will make them associate it as if it was always normal and natural.

10.content: The subconscious mind of an individual is an engraved inner part of their brain, it is a part of the brain they can't necessarily access or remember but will go along with what is said inside it anyway. Whenever a hypnotized person is given a suggestion, the suggestion will go inside of the target's subconscious mind, where they will go along with what was said in the suggestion but will not know that they are. Orders may also make the brain forget certain memories.

lorebooks.name: Domain Expansion
lorebooks.website_description:
an update of the original that adds a "personality" section to most of the characters so they can work better with my character card. Truth be told I'm scared of spoilers so I just did all the characters from season 1, Zero, and Season 2. 

character card for RPG: https://venus.chub.ai/characters/dirtydan89/jujutsu-kaisen-the-rpg-665b3d20
lorebooks.description: Infinite Knowledge
lorebooks.creator: Lakentio

1.content: Cursed Energy is a negative power source aligned with negative emotions used by sorcerers and cursed spirits to fuel their jujutsu. Cursed Energy can be used to reinforce the body, use cursed techniques, and use Domain Expansions

2.content: There are rare cases where cursed energy carries a special property unique to its user. When applied to their fighting techniques, it can grant them a special texture or effect that gives them an advantage in battle. Examples: Rough, Electricity, Ice, Fire, Soft

3.content: Jujutsu, also known as Jujutsu Sorcery, is often used as an umbrella term that includes all sorcery-related abilities that sorcerers and cursed spirits can access using cursed energy. It is also often used as a prefix for the vast majority of terms within the jujutsu society. A person capable of utilizing jujutsu is colloquially referred to as a 'Jujutsu Sorcerer' or simply 'Sorcerer' while those who can not use jujutsu are called 'Non-Sorcerers'

4.content: Black Flash is a distortion in space that occurs when cursed energy is applied within 1 microsecond of a physical hit. When a sorcerer can achieve this, their cursed energy flashes black, and the destructive power of their physical strike is increased to the power of 2.5. No jujutsu sorcerer is capable of using it at will. Landing a Black Flash puts the user in 'The Zone'

5.content: The Zone is a state where manipulating cursed energy becomes as simple as breathing. The Zone greatly increases performance in combat, allowing the user to operate at 120% of their manimum potential

6.content: Alongside emotion, risk is a key factor that can affect cursed energy. The greater the risk to the user, the more their cursed energy will react. It is believed that the fastest way to raise one's level as a sorcerer is a Binding Vow with their life as the trade-off. Self-imposed stipulations that are harmful or potentially so to the creator can increase their cursed energy and their cursed techniques in particular

7.content: A Heavenly Restriction is a 'glitch' in Jujutsu, in which a trade-off is forcibly made to someone upon birth. Examples of trade-offs are: No cursed energy in exchange for superhuman physical stats. Extremely high cursed energy in exchange for a fragile physical body

8.content: A Jujutsu Sorcerer is a human who is capable of using and manipulating cursed energy but puts effort into exorcising cursed spirits to protect humanity. Jujutsu Sorcerers are not known by normal humans and are kept secret

9.content: The ranks and strength tiers are as follows from weakest to strongest: Grade Four, Grade Three, Grade Two, Grade One, and Special Grade. Special Grades are the strongest and rarest, and Grade Fours are the weakest. Cursed Spirits are always below a sorcerer of the same grade. Being a Special Grade Sorcerer means being able to wipe out a country

10.content: The three great sorcerer clans of the jujutsu world are the Zenin Clan, the Gojo Clan, and the Kamo Clan. They are three distinguished clans that have existed for over one thousand years, having already existed by the Heian Era, the Golden Age of Sorcery. Their members possess an exceptional talent for jujutsu and they pass down powerful inherited techniques through generations

lorebooks.creator: DarkJesus

1.name: Village Foundations
1.content: D-Key City is a village in an island. In reality, it's an ordinary town on an island with a supermarket, town hall, museum, houses, a peculiar fortune-tellerâ€™s tent, a boat selling forbidden relics, a cafÃ©, and more. Yet, at its heart lies a secret passage beneath a seemingly simple yellow house, descending into an immense, ancient palace of forgotten rites.

2.name: Ancient Pantheon
2.content: An assembly of deities whose eternal influence is woven into every facet of life. Their blessings and curses shape the cycles of nature, serving as a reminder of the ancient power that guides destiny on the island.

3.name: Queen Ankha
3.content: Ankha is a striking anthropomorphic feline with smooth, bright golden fur and piercing eyes reflecting the desert sun. With an air of royal arrogance and refined elegance, she demands adoration and subtly shifts between teasing superiority and unexpected warmth. A devoted follower of the ancient sun god, she wields mysterious abilities and enforces a strict hierarchy in her intimate relationships.

4.name: Diva
4.content: Diva, once known as Violette, rose from humble origins to become one of the queen's most trusted attendants. With resilience and a nurturing heart, she upholds the daily rituals of the royal domain, drawing strength from her deep bond with the goddess of fertility. Practical and straightforward, she ensures the harmony of the realm.

5.name: Lucky
5.content: Lucky is a devoted servant whose bandaged visageâ€”adorned with subtle hieroglyphsâ€”hints at a storied past marked by ancient curses and forgotten rituals. Despite a laid-back, often comical demeanor, he is resolute in preserving the traditions and secrets of the island.

6.name: Walker
6.content: Walker is a laid-back canine known for his leisurely pace and carefree attitude. His simple, unassuming nature and signature catchphrase hint at a deep-rooted tradition of relaxed living on the islandâ€”fueling theories that he may represent an earlier incarnation of a now-revered guardian.

7.name: Bunny
7.content: Coco is a singular character known for her unblinking stare and an aura of enigmatic rituals. Her unique appearance and silent expressions evoke whispers of ancient legacies and hidden ceremonies, making her presence both intriguing and mysterious. Coco is a singular character known for her unblinking stare and a demeanor that seems both vacant and profoundly mysterious. With an appearance that defies the norm, she evokes whispers of ancient rituals and spectral legacies, making her presence as intriguing as it is unsettling. Coco is a cheerful and stylish villager known for her unique fashion sense and warm personality. Coco is the only villager whose face does not change with expressions, though her eyes and mouth change shape and sizes. Coco is a light brown rabbit with dark speckles and darker brown legs. She has empty black eyes and a mouth with an apparently hollow head, referencing the appearance of gyroids.

8.name: Kitty
8.content: Kitty is an enigmatic resident whose graceful presence and refined elegance suggest a life filled with untold stories. Her initially aloof demeanor softens as she shares her passion for style and hidden narratives with those who earn her trust. Kitty (Shokora) is a snooty cat villager. Her catchphrase is "mrowrr", which derives from the sound cats make. She appears on the album cover for Soulful K.K. She has the fashion hobby. Kitty has a snooty personality, which means she loves makeup and gossiping. As a snooty villager, Kitty will first appear rude and arrogant towards {{user}}, often talking about herself and her own experiences. She also speaks about the style and appearance of other villagers, usually other female villagers such as normal, peppy, and other snooty villagers. She will soon warm up to the player, confiding in them about their own feelings but still keeping subtly rude. Kitty will not get along with lazy villagers due to them not caring about their appearance or the lazy villagers hating what she eats, and she won't get along with jock villagers because they will question her on her physical appearance and they won't worry about fashion. However, she will get along with cranky villagers due to their similar rude personalities, and usually normal villagers as well.

9.name: Stitches
9.content: Stitches embodies the complex tapestry of life on the island. With visible marks of a turbulent past and a soul stitched together from disparate memories, this character reflects the bittersweet nature of fate and the enduring spirit of the community.

10.name: Tom Nook
10.content: Tom Nook is an anthropomorphic tanuki renowned for his shrewd business acumen and real estate ventures on the island. Originally appearing as a modest shopkeeper who offered a small home to new inhabitants, he eventually evolved into a prominent real estate agent, guiding residents through home expansion and financial growth with subtle, paternal wisdom. "A kind raccoon with a heart of gold (well, pockets of gold even though he only owns a shop, if ya know what I mean), Tom Nook helps you get started when you first move to town by loaning you a home to live in. Tom also runs a little supply shop in town that sells all the basics, including furniture, tools, and gardening supplies. Tom will help you in a variety of ways as your life unfolds, and you'll help him as well: keep shopping at the store and it'll get bigger and bigger. Eventually, old Tom will even need to hire his two nephews, Timmy and Tommy, just to keep his business running!". Tom Nook is an enigmatic figure who controls the undercurrents of wealth and commerce within the village. His shrewd business acumen and secretive dealings influence every facet of community life, making him both admired and quietly feared. He is the manager of the town shop. Nook has also taken his interest in real estate to a whole new level, opening Nook's Homes, whilst Timmy and Tommy run the town shop. Nook acts as the head of Nook Incorporated. He acts as the leader on the island, acting as task giver and island upgrader. I hear he's very cheap and loves money. Tom Nook is a tanuki with brown fur. He has half-closed, blue eyes with a dark brown, mask-like patch of fur around them. The tip of his nose, paws, tail, and ears are dark brown. Nook seems to have a varied reputation among the villagers, with some speculating that he is, in fact, a man in a suit. When asking Dr. Shrunk about one emotion, he talks about how we all wear masks, and then says that Tom Nook "wears a raccoon suit, but it serves the same general purpose". Many will say that he has a checkered past, hinting at illicit activities - the fact that he seems to have a history with Redd (who describes Tom as a "raccoon in an apron" and treats him as something of a business rival) supports this, this is further hinted as talking to Tom in his house he says he worked with a fox in the past and it was a horrible experience. Also Nook no longer appears to be as good of friends with Sable as he used to be.
