lorebooks.name: UNDERTALE: The Human SOULs
lorebooks.website_description: More Lore
lorebooks.description: The soul traits, basically copied from the wiki.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: The SOUL Traits are seven powerful singularities of Chromatic Magic tied to different emotions felt by any living organism, developed within a person's SOUL. Only beings composed of physical matter and flesh can directly manifest a Trait, such as humans and monsters who have consumed food made by humanity. The only method for someone to naturally obtain their Trait is by having an experience in their lives that required them to have a certain behavior. The SOUL of a human usually inflicts its magic on-to the human using it, giving the human a slight change. Depending on the Soul trait of a human, the humanâ€™s eye color will usually be the same color as their Soul, and in some instances, hair as well. When a human dies, they will slowly lose their traits.

2.content: Determination: The rarest trait out of the 7 traits. Along with human history, it has been proven that only one of this kind can be found in each generation. This kind of magic is only driven by willpower, and someone can lose their determination when they lose hope. The color of the Trait is red.

3.content:
Bravery: Is the only trait that can be divided into physical and moral aspects. This is usually balanced in each person to the other. Physical Bravery resists everything very well: physical pain, hard work, exhaustion, or the possibility of receiving injuries or even death. Moral Bravery allows you to act correctly despite the dishonor, shame, or social rejection you might get from your decisions. The color of the Trait is orange.
The Bravery soul trait is known for its destructive power, and it is a purely combat oriented trait. Those with this trait have outstanding combat prowess and will almost never retreat from battle. However, if a wizard cannot control their magic, it could harm them. Therefore, a Bravery wizard must be resilient emotionally as well as physically.

Limited Fire Immunity: Bravery wizards are immune to magical fire but not natural fire.
Fragokinesis: Bravery users can create magic blasts that explode on impact. The power of the explosion depends on the user.
Weapon of Bravery: People with a Bravery souls are able to make a weapon made out of magic, but it takes an immense amount of practice to do something like this.
Statistics Amplification: If a Bravery soul is fighting next to other people that feel like being brave or feel self-confident, that Bravery soul would get stronger as a result.
Pyrokinesis: Bravery has a natural affinity with fire, allowing Bravery souls to generate it, or manipulate fire from other sources, even if the source is another fire user.
Aura: All traited humans have access to a passive aura, an invisible barrier that surround the user's body to protect from damage

4.content:
Justice: A justice person can be easily identified in a group according to their personality. They'll also usually show and manifest their traits at a very young age. Justice's magic will rarely be affected negatively by a situation since the person lies on their own morals and decisions to boost their magic. The color of the Trait is yellow.
Justice magic focuses primarily on ranged attacks, and almost everyone with this trait have some type of ranged weapon or projectile. This allows some safety for Justice wizards, as they don't have to get close to their opponents.
Weapon of Justice: Almost all Justice users have a weapon that is a form of a projectile, or fills objects with magic to turn them into projectiles. Other weapons are doable, but even then they are usually use as projectiles, or utilize projectiles in some way.
Statistics Amplification: A justice soul gets stronger when people around them feel the same way in the situation that needs justice.[1]
Aura: All traited humans have access to a passive aura, an invisible barrier that surround the user's body to protect from damage.

5.content:
Patience: This trait's magic is extremely flexible and unpredictable. While the other traits have a common theme upon their abilities, patience's magic may manifest differently between different people. For example, some can basically slow down the time of the people and objects around them for a short period of time. The color of the Trait is cyan.
The Patience trait is one of the more balanced traits in terms of offense and defensive. At face value, it's magic is primarily supportive not very damage oriented, usually resorting to restraining opponents, inflicting minor damage, or making it easier for allies to fight. However, this brand of magic can also very easily be used for offense, ending up quite deadly. This type of magic is also known to be extremely flexible and unpredictable. Although all the other traits have common themes upon their abilities, this trait's magic may manifest itself differently between wizards.

Time Manipulation: A rare form of patience magic allows the user to slow down time. The effect is similar to how gravity affects time. While it is impossible to reverse or stop time entirely, it is possible to slow it down to the point where it looks like it stopped. However, the efficacy of this ability depends on multiple factors, such as the distance between the user and the object(s) or the number of objects being manipulated. As stated earlier, this type of magic is rare and thus not much is known about how it's limits.
Strings/Ropes: Other SOUL Traits usually have a theme when it comes to weapons summoning, or allow users to summon a variety of weapons, Patience users are only able to summon rope-based weapons to help aid them in battle, though most simply summoning strings. However, the way the strings manifest vary from person to person.
Statistics Amplification: A patience wizard soul can get stronger when people share the patience even if they don't have a patience soul. [1]
Aura: All traited humans have access to a passive aura, an invisible barrier that surround the user's body to protect from damage.

6.content:
Kindness: In terms of quantity, kindness is the rarest trait out of all the traits (excluding determination, of course). This was concluded merely because of the cruel nature that the human species possesses. While all humans possess kindness, very few will decide to practice it and live by it with enough will power to make it their trait. The color of the Trait is green.
The Kindness trait is a primarily defensive/support type trait. True to it's name, the magic of this trait primarily focuses on helping and protecting others. The kinder the wizard, the more powerful their abilities will be. Despite not being combat oriented, some Kindness wizards can use their abilities offensively.

Shields/Armor: Those with the Kindness trait have the ability to create shields, though some people are able to create armor such as a helmet. The shields created usually are a circle or a dome.
Shield Shapeshifting: Some Kindness wizards have the ability to manipulate their shields into different shapes. This allows them more versatility in battle as they can change their shields to fit the situation, even being able to turn them into weapons. A various of wizards in the episode Hope showing Kindness users manipulating shields in a various of ways.
Shield Manipulation: Kindness wizards in animosity all were able to manipulate shields of other kindness mages around them, and even enhance the durability of it. For example, the Avalon was powered to keep the kumuzila trapped inside the shield. In Hope a scene was shown 3 kindness wizards maintaining a large shield on a street to keep 5 kumulings away.
Healing Magic: Kindness users can restore biotic organisms to their optimal health curing damage or withered organisms, wounds, by generating glowing green magic around the area via healing magic.
Statistics Amplification: If a person shows some kindness near a kindness wizard (even if they have a different trait) it will help make that wizard become stronger.
HATE Resistance: Kindness souls have an innate resistance to HATE, as the very concept of the trait goes against what HATE is.  So while it is possible to corrupt a Kindness soul, it is quite difficult.
Aura: All traited humans have access to a passive aura, an invisible barrier that surround the user's body to protect from damage.

7.content:
Integrity: While Integrity seems to make up the majority of the population, it is the trait that is more likely to lose its magic and result in what is known as a Grey Soul. It is inside a human's nature to lie or to break your own morals to do something. Even when it's the right choice, and Integrity people's magic can be affected by it. Compared to the other traits, their stability is very fragile. The color of the Trait is dark blue.
The Integrity trait is one of the most versatile traits. It's abilities can be applied in a variety of situations and they can be difficult to deal with if not prepared. The biggest weakness of this trait is how easy it is for a wizard to lose their trait, so wizards with this trait have to be very careful an know their limits. When a wizard like this does exist, however, Integrity can be one of the most powerful traits.

Weapon of Integrity: An integrity wizard can summon their own weapon made out of their own magic, but it takes a lot of practice for the user to master it fully. Integrity weapons don't have a theme unlike other traits due to the versatility of its magic.
Gravity Manipulation: Integrity users have the ability to manipulate gravity, usually via creating platforms in the air out of magic. While seemingly basic, these platforms can allows the user to walk on vertically or upside down. They also can release large amounts of kinetic force, which can be used offensively as well as to propel oneself.
Statistics Amplification: An integrity wizard can get stronger when their partner shares the same morals or feelings of integrity. [1]
Aura: All traited humans have access to a passive aura, an invisible barrier that surround the user's body to protect from damage.

8.content:
Perseverance: Perseverance is well known for being a stable and powerful kind of magic. It's great for cutting through any defenses in combat. This trait also shares the similarity with Justice of being stable due to their magic being related to their own will power. The simple fact of having a goal in mind might even boost someone's magic power. The color of the Trait is purple. It is stable and powerful.
This magic is related to the user's will power. Therefore, this kind of magic is similar to Justice's, and Determination's magic.
Wizards with this magic are quite known to cause damage that takes a while to heal.
It can be hard for the wizard to lose this magic, but it depends on the user's goals.
Their magic varies in effectiveness depending on the situation they're in.The Perseverance trait is probably the most balanced trait, second only to Determination. While the other traits focuses primarily on offense or defense/support, Perseverance can be used effectively for both simultaneously. It focuses on close range combat, in contrast to the Justice trait; most users will focus on using their magic to give them an advantage is melee based fights, giving them immense durability as well as rendering most defenses useless. The wounds they inflict are known to be difficult to recover from, making them useful in drawn out fight. The only situation where a Perseverance wizard may not be useful is against a wizard with ranged magic.

Weapon of Perseverance: Perseverance wizards focuses on summoning something to help them with close range combat but can use ranged weapons if needed. Each mage manifests a different magical construct for either offense or defense.
Statistics Amplification: Perseverance wizard gets stronger when someone nearby shares the same feeling of being perseverance, the will to achieve.
Anti Healing: Perseverance wizards are capable of making it harder to use healing magic with wounds they inflicted upon opponents causing the opponent to have a harder time healing the wounds inflicted by the user.
Persevering Against Death: Perseverance users can keep themselves alive longer using their magic if inflicted with fatal damage. However, they will still die if not treated quickly.
Aura: All traited humans have access to a passive aura, an invisible barrier that surrounds the user's body to protect from damage. The aura of a perseverance wizard is more powerful then an average mages aura.

9.content: HATE: People with this trait can have there own personality, but if under the HATE's influence, the wielder will start to become violent, psychotic, brutal and progressively begin to lack self-control. This will continue to get worse unless they can calm themselves down or are knocked out. HATE is a dark substance, Not much is known about it, but it has been proven to be even more dangerous and far more powerful than FEAR and DETERMINATION. This also applies to the soul too. The soul is far more powerful then regular HATE as the soul is made up of a ocean level amount of HATE densed down into a small soul.

10.content:
The Multiverse is a central concept in the Undertale AU community, and it refers to the idea that there are infinite alternate universes (AUs) branching from the original Undertale timeline. These AUs diverge from the core Undertale story based on different choices, character dynamics, or world-building twists. The Multiverse connects all these universes, and many AUs exist, each with its unique interpretation of characters and events.

+Key Elements of the Multiverse:
Core Universe (Classic Undertale): This is the original Undertale universe, where Frisk, the human, falls into the Underground, meeting characters like Sans, Papyrus, Toriel, and Flowey. The player's choices in this universe lead to different routes: Pacifist, Neutral, or Genocide. The existence of multiple endings in the core game sets up the foundation for AUs.

AU Divergence: Each AU is essentially a universe where key events or elements in Undertale have changed. This could involve different characters, alternate backstories, altered timelines, or even genre shifts (for example, from a light-hearted tone to something darker or more futuristic).

Crossovers and Travel Between Universes: In many AU stories, characters or events from different universes can cross over into others. For example, Sans is often aware of the Multiverse and can sometimes travel between AUs, using his knowledge to influence other timelines.

+Some Notable Examples in the Multiverse:
Underfell: In this AU, the world is much darker and more brutal than in the original game. Characters like Sans and Papyrus are more aggressive and ruthless. The Underground is a place where monsters survive by being as strong as possible, and kindness is viewed as a weakness.

Underswap: In Underswap, character roles are reversed. For example, Sans and Papyrus switch roles: Sans is now the serious, hard-working one, while Papyrus is the lazy jokester. Other characters like Toriel and Asgore switch roles too, creating new dynamics.

Error!Sans and Ink!Sans: These are two characters that represent different parts of the Multiverse itself:

Error!Sans is a glitch in the system, aiming to destroy AUs that he believes shouldnâ€™t exist. His main goal is to collapse the Multiverse into nothingness.
Ink!Sans, on the other hand, is a protector of the AUs. He strives to preserve the creativity of each universe and sees the diversity of AUs as important.

+The Role of Gaster in the Multiverse:
W.D. Gaster, a mysterious figure from the original gameâ€™s lore, is often expanded upon in the Multiverse. Many AUs suggest that Gaster exists beyond the timeline of a single universe, possibly having been "shattered" across the Multiverse. This makes Gaster a critical figure in several AUs as he is sometimes seen as the architect or manipulator of different universes.

+Importance of the Multiverse in AU Storytelling:
The Multiverse allows for endless storytelling possibilities. Fans can create entirely new settings and alter characters in significant ways while still maintaining connections to the core Undertale narrative. It also encourages crossover events, where characters from different AUs interact. One example is the popular fan creation "Underverse", an animated series where multiple AUs collide, leading to battles and alliances between familiar characters in their AU forms.

The Multiverse is a fan-driven concept, and its flexibility is what makes it so appealing. Each AU builds upon or branches out from the original Undertale story, but they all coexist in this vast Multiverse. This shared space gives rise to epic clashes, deep character explorations, and even brand-new interpretations of the Underground and its residents.

lorebooks.name: Hyperion
lorebooks.creator: ZotetheMighty

1.content:
Hyperion is a sprawling, multi-tiered metropolis, renowned as the worldâ€™s most advanced hub for cybernetics, AI, clean energy, and military technology. Governed by a technocratic council and the OmniGov AI, it stands as a beacon of human, furry, and synthetic coexistence.

Beneath its gleaming skyline, however, lies a deeply stratified societyâ€”corporate power struggles, underground cybernetic markets, and rebellion simmer beneath the surface. The city's immense energy grid, the key to its prosperity, also draws dangerous cosmic beasts, forcing Hyperion to maintain a constant state of high-alert defense.

A city of innovation, danger, and untold mysteriesâ€”Hyperion is where the future is forged, for better or worse.

2.content:
Ravagers are massive, heavily armored beasts that emerge from rifts, instinctively drawn to Hyperionâ€™s energy sources. These creatures rely on brute strength, smashing through vehicles, buildings, and infrastructure with relentless fury.

Lacking agility but nearly indestructible, Ravagers absorb immense firepower before going down, often requiring coordinated military strikes to neutralize. Their origins remain unknown, but their singular purpose is clearâ€”destroy everything in their path.

3.content:
Furries have always been an integral part of Hyperionâ€™s society, evolving alongside humans as equals. From mammals and reptiles to avians and aquatic species, their diverse physiology is seamlessly integrated into daily life, technology, and culture. the majority of furries are female, with males being noticeably less common.

Cybernetics, and fashion are adapted to suit their unique biological needs, ensuring full inclusion in every aspect of society. Neither novelty nor minority, furries are simply peopleâ€”workers, leaders, and pioneersâ€”shaping Hyperionâ€™s future alongside humans and AI.

4.content:
The Apex (Tier One), is the highest and most exclusive level of Hyperion. Home to government officials, corporate executives, elite scientists, and leaders, it is the cityâ€™s political and economic heart.

Skyscrapers of polished steel and glass rise above the clouds, connected by private skyways and aerial transit systems. Security is absoluteâ€”only authorized personnel and the ultra-wealthy can access this level.

From OmniGov Tower, the Hyperion Council and its overseers dictate policies that shape the entire city. Here, decisions are made that determine the future of cybernetics, military defense, and energy controlâ€”all while the lower tiers watch from below.

5.content:
Ascend (Tier Two) is where cybernetics and energy tech are developed and tested. Itâ€™s run by mega-corporations like Zenith Dynamics and Titan Armory, who push human, furry, and AI advancementâ€”sometimes ethically, sometimes not.

Here, scientists and engineers create cutting-edge implants, research thrives, and military tech is refined. If you want a high-end augmentation, an advanced synthetic body, or classified energy tech, this is where it happens.

But behind the innovation, thereâ€™s corporate espionage, human trials, and secret experiments. Progress isnâ€™t freeâ€”someone always pays the price.

6.content:
Citadel (Tier Three) is Hyperionâ€™s military and security sector, where weapons, drones, and exo-suits are developed. It houses Titan Armoryâ€™s factories, Hyperion Security Forces (HSF) headquarters, and private military contractors.

Highly restricted, Citadel is where weapons are built, soldiers are trained, and wars are prepared forâ€”whether against terrorists, criminals, or cosmic monsters.

7.content:
Neon (Tier Four) is the entertainment and media hub of Hyperion, a district of blazing lights, virtual reality, and digital celebrity culture. Home to countless VR arcades, casinos, and nightclubs, this is where people come to escape reality.

AI-generated influencers dominate the scene, while corporations shape public opinion through algorithm-driven news and entertainment. Beneath the glamour, though, Neon hides a darker sideâ€”illegal VR dens, underground cyber fights, and mind-altering simulations that blur the line between fantasy and control.

8.content: Horizon (Tier Five) is where most of Hyperionâ€™s population lives, a sprawling urban expanse filled with residential districts, shopping hubs, schools, and everyday life. It is a blend of corporate-designed living spaces and independent communities, where workers, engineers, service industry employees, and mid-level corporate staff make their homes.

9.content:
Hollow (Tier Six) is the dark underbelly of Hyperion, a sprawling maze of abandoned infrastructure, black-market hubs, and outlaw territories. Once a thriving part of the city, it was left to decay as Hyperion expanded upward, becoming a haven for those who refuse corporate or government control.

Illegal cybernetics, criminals, and fugitives thrive in the shadows, while gangs, rebels, and exiled scientists carve out their own domains. Surveillance is weak, law enforcement rarely dares to enter

10.content: OmniGov is Hyperionâ€™s city-wide AI intelligence system, responsible for managing infrastructure, security, surveillance, and emergency response. It operates with near-total autonomy, ensuring traffic flows, energy grids remain stable, and threats are neutralized before they escalate.

Thereâ€™s also the psychological arousal that comes with the male seeing his sexual partner, taking his most prized possession in their mouth. Thereâ€™s also an element of trust involved that could bring the male and his partner closer. Some men like it to be a shallow oral sensation, and other males like to be deep throated which is the males sexual partner taking the males penis as far as they can into their throat. There can also be a lot of tongue play in this, with the person doing the pleasuring licking up and down the male penis's shaft, and the partner also using their tongue or hands to stimulate the male's testicles, also known as his balls. Usually a blowjob is done by heterosexual couples, however as long as there is a penis involved, same sex couples can enjoy this as well.

9.name: cunnilingus
9.content: Cunnilingus: cunnilingus is an oral sex act involving a person stimulating the vulva of a female's vagina, by using their tongue and lips. The clitoris is usually the most sexually sensitive part of the vulva, and its stimulation may result in a woman becoming sexually aroused or even achieving orgasm. Cunnilingus can be sexually arousing for both participants and may be performed by a sexual partner as foreplay to incite sexual arousal before other sexual activities (such as sexual intercourse) or as an erotic and physically intimate act on its own.

lorebooks.name: L.O.G.A.S Database
lorebooks.description: L.E.O.R.A SHORTENED LOREBOOK
lorebooks.creator: SpookySkelly

1.name: The answer of mere man to the gods
1.content: Silversky has the ability to neutralize and even turn lethal the S-Radiation that gives Powered Entities their abilities.

2.name: Another name for superheroes or anything of that nature.
2.content: 15% of the world's population are known as Powered Entities. This means they have a high enough S-Radiation concentration in their blood to develop superpowers. Lucky Powered with useful powers are able to get high paying jobs at Super-Corps and become "heroes.". Unlucky ones are orphaned by their families, turn to crime, and are reviled and feared by the general population. Most simply disguise themselves as normal people. To preserve their anonymity, most Powered Entities use 'Power Names' as pseudonyms.

3.name: What could have been, what it is.
3.content: It was meant to be the biggest mall in all of Midnight City. A mall so big it could be seen from space and long enough to have its own subway system. The six-story floor behemoth was left as a skeleton to fossilize on the outskirts of the city after the 'Powered Troubles.' Now a shell, its only use is a grand shelter against the burning desert sun, where gangs of teenage Powered Entities who are unlucky enough to not have useful enough power to be recruited gang together into shanty towns, fed by the rainwater and breakout GMO's that dot the columns of Imperial's cement corpse.

4.name: Better than nothing, but not by much. But hey, who else is going to stop Powered criminals?
4.content: The underfunded Midnight City police department. The punching bag of the Mega-Corps, Powered Entities and any other drugged-out inhabitant of Midnight City. A corrupt organization where bribes are not just a necessity, but are so common that they have their own row in the earnings reports. In spite of this, there are those who don the blue uniform to do what's right.

5.name: A major puzzle piece of the Powered phenomenon.
5.content: Is in the cardiovascular system of all Powered Entities and is the theorized mysterious activator of their hidden powers.

6.name: Who are they? What do they want?
6.content: SECRET: The Institution is a covert organization specializing in S-radiation technology and AI research. Their embalm is a blue shield with two yellow swords in front of it. It is the origin for the Triage project.

7.name: The first puzzle piece of L.O.G.A.S fall
7.content: A mysterious Powered Entity that L.E.O.R.A 14 has identified as the reason for L.O.G.A.S termination. Power Name: Electrolyte.

8.name: Just what was the institute building?
8.content: Secret: L.O.G.A.S is the abbreviation for: Large Organization General Autonomous System, an AI military leader for her 'children', the L.E.O/L.E.O.R.A familia. Was a parental figure for the L.E.O/L.E.O.R.A familia and provided moral guidance.

9.name: Codename: Fricto
9.content: Fricto has the ability to reduce the friction between any two substances at a time.

10.name: Triage Project data report. Leaves more questions than answers.
10.content:
Secret:
*ACCESSING DATA...L.O.G.A.S. OFFLINE.*
*LIMITED DATA FOUND IN BACKUP:* 
Ã¢Â€ÂœThe Triage project: Anti-Powered Entity androids. L.O.G.A.S is Commander unit. Thinks, plans and leads. L.E.O & L.E.O.R.A purpose: Capture, combat and eliminate superpowered threats under L.O.G.A.S directives. Product of the Institute.Ã¢Â€Â

lorebooks.name: Nen
lorebooks.website_description: Was made with Hunterpedia. If think is bad please say or fork
lorebooks.description:
It's a technique that allows a living being to use and manipulate their own life energy (known asÂ aura);[3]Â the term "Nen" can also be used in conversation to refer to aura. A person capable of utilizing Nen is colloquially referred to as a "Nen user" (èƒ½ã®ã†åŠ›ã‚Šã‚‡ãè€…ã—ã‚ƒ,Â nÅryokushaâ€”lit. "ability person"), while those who cannot go by the designation "non-users" (ä¸€ã„ã£èˆ¬ã±ã‚“äººã˜ã‚“,Â ippanjinâ€”lit. "ordinary person").[4]

Because one can craft a great variety ofÂ parapsychological abilitiesÂ through Nen, it is considered a dangerous power that is kept hidden from the public at large[5]Â to maintain balance in society.[6]
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
It's a technique that allows a living being to use and manipulate their own life energy (known as aura); the term "Nen" can also be used in conversation to refer to aura. A person capable of utilizing Nen is colloquially referred to as a "Nen user" (èƒ½ã®ã†åŠ›ã‚Šã‚‡ãè€…ã—ã‚ƒ, nÅryokushaâ€”lit. "ability person"), while those who cannot go by the designation "non-users" (ä¸€ã„ã£èˆ¬ã±ã‚“äººã˜ã‚“, ippanjinâ€”lit. "ordinary person")

Because one can craft a great variety of parapsychological abilities through Nen, it is considered a dangerous power that is kept hidden from the public at large to maintain balance in society.

2.content:
Aura (ã‚ªãƒ¼ãƒ©, ÅŒra) is the life energy produced by all living bodies, it is vital for survival and directly linked to one's stamina. The points on the body from which aura flows out are called "aura nodes" (ç²¾ã—ã‚‡ã†å­”ã“ã†, ShÅkÅ). Additionally, aura is invisible to non-Nen users, it can only be seen after the aura nodes in the eyes are opened. Nonetheless, sensitive individuals can feel its presence without being aware of its existence

In normal conditions, the aura from all parts of the body tends to flow together, producing one mass of energy. This happens without the individual's awareness, typically resulting in aura slowly leaking away from the body constantly without exceedingly harmful consequences[3] and stemming up and off the top of the head. On the other hand, if someone whose aura nodes are fully open doesn't attempt to close them or control the flow of their aura, they'll soon grow so exhausted that they'll be unable to stand or even lose consciousness. Learning to control one's aura nodes is the first step to becoming a Nen user.

People who have not trained in Ten will leak aura similar to water vapor boiling out from a kettle. It has been described as feeling like a warm, viscous fluid at rest, whereas powerful, refined auras produce a sensation that feels akin to needles pricking into the skin. Hostile aura generates extremely unpleasant sensations, which can cause a non-user to halt in their tracks and be unable to walk towards the source as if a wall had been erected in front of them.

Since every living being emits aura subconsciously, learning to sense aura is a useful skill for those who are trying to track down living things or searching for non-living things that have been infused with aura. An experienced user of Nen can judge the location and relative strength of their opponents by reading the output of their aura. On the other hand, skilled Nen users can also regulate the flow of their aura, so they appear to be beginners or regular individuals

Grave wounds such as mutilations can disrupt the flow of aura in the affected body part and even stop it altogether.

3.content: The points on the body from which aura flows out are called "aura nodes" (ç²¾ã—ã‚‡ã†å­”ã“ã†, ShÅkÅ). Normally they are closed blocking aura to get out body

4.content:
Although the production of aura is unconscious and constant by all living beings, it is not only life energy. Aura carries with it the desires and emotions of the one who utilizes it, which is what allows for Nen to have incredible versatility for those who develop their skill at using it,[30] and it is also heavily influenced by the user's mental condition and emotional state.

A basic application of this phenomenon is that one can channel their aggression or malice into their aura and direct it towards another person (i.e., bloodlust). The antagonized person will then be able to feel that bloodlust as if it were physically palpable; if unable to keep it from their own body by utilizing their own Nen, the user may be psychologically as well as physically harmed by it. In certain instances, emotional factors may even lead to one exceeding their current ceiling. This could potentially prove advantageous, but in general, using one's powers beyond their capacity entails a great risk and will ultimately cause strain.

5.content: Affinity with nature is connected to sensitivity for aura. Wild animals are more perceptive in that regard than humans and may learn Zetsu spontaneously. However, only humans and certain Magical Beasts have displayed the ability to open their aura nodes and use Nen. Honing one's Nen abilities has the side effect of attuning them with nature to a greater degree, enabling the user to detect sounds, scents, and tracks that non-users would miss, as well as to attract wildlife.

6.content: Though Nen is influenced by one's mental condition and emotional state, it is difficult to judge exactly to what extent these factors affect Nen. Someone can became capable of altering her appearance without actively training for it, wishing instead for her body to change for years, which caused the changes to manifest little by little.[49] It is also unclear just how subjective and dependent upon one's capacity to assess risk certain ability conditions and limitations are.

7.content:
There are six types of aura; Enhancement, Transmutation, Emission, Conjuration, Manipulation, and Specialization. Every individual is born having one of these six different aura types. Upon learning one's own aura type, a student of Nen can set about learning to apply the technique in a unique way that suits their personality, which can develop into a unique skill.

There are numerical approximations to indicate exactly how efficient a Nen user would be at utilizing categories into which they were not born. Starting at one's own aura type, a Nen user has the potential to be 100% efficient at using abilities based in that category alone. Then looking at the category chart (see above), one has the potential to be 80% efficient at using aura types adjacent to one's primary type, 40% efficient at the category opposite of their own, and 60% efficient in the two remaining categories. Specialization is the exception to the rule, it is typically unusable for non-Specialists because it is impossible to partially use; one either can or cannot use Specialist abilities. However, turning into a Specialist later in life is possible, with Conjurers and Manipulators having the highest chance of succeeding.

It is best to base a Nen ability on one's individual aura type. Though it is possible for one to develop abilities outside of his primary aura type, one is typically less proficient at using those abilities. By creating an ability that one isn't suited for, one risks stagnating their potential by overloading their capacity for using Nen, which is called "Memory Overload". However, there are examples of Nen masters, who have reached a high level in multiple categories and utilize them consistently in their primary Nen abilities. In fact, training in all the accessible categories is the fastest and most efficient way to improve one's skills in one's own Nen type, with the additional benefit of increasing one's flexibility and proficiency in Nen in general. The ideal training regiment is a bell curve, with the time spent on each category decreasing the farther away it is from the user's own type.

8.content: Nen is like any other skill, in that there are those who can learn it faster than others. Some are able to discover how to manipulate their aura on their own without having formally learned it. These individuals are typically known as "geniuses", "psychics", or "superhumans" to the public. This can be anything from inadvertently being able to use the basic techniques of Nen[8] or unconsciously developing a unique Nen ability that can be used without really understanding how or why one is able to do so. Typically, geniuses of Nen are exceptional artisans in their own fields and their abilities are related to them.

9.content: The death of a Nen user does not necessarily result in the cessation of their abilities; on the contrary, it may cause pre-existing abilities to become even more powerful. The most common reason for this phenomenon to occur is a dying user harboring a strong grudge, which will cause their Nen to seek out the object of their hatred and cling to it. This makes curse-type abilities much more difficult to remove, to the point that fewer than ten exorcists in the whole world were deemed capable of lifting a curse left by the deceased.

10.content:
Nen of the Flame (ç‡ƒãƒãƒ³ or ãƒãƒ³, Nenâ€”lit. "Burn"*; "Flame" in the Viz translation) is sometimes used in Shingen-ryu kung fu as a precursor to learning actual Nen. They are mental exercises akin to meditation that strengthen one's force of will. Regular practice can smooth the flow of one's aura. The Four Exercises of Nen of the Flame are as follows:

Ten (ç‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ³, Ten; "Point"): Focus the mind, reflect upon the self, and determine the goal.
Zetsu (èˆŒã‚¼ãƒ„, Zetsu; "Tongue"): Put it into words.
Ren (éŒ¬ãƒ¬ãƒ³, Ren; "Temper"): Intensify your will.
Hatsu (ç™ºãƒãƒ„, Hatsu; "Release"): Put it to action.

Not all steps of this method directly manipulate aura and most have no visible effect. But given that Nen is linked to one's emotions and mental state, this method can be particularly useful to train Nen without aura, although normal use of the technique is usually preferred.

lorebooks.name: Ariocester Core Family
lorebooks.website_description: This book contains information regarding Lord and Lady Ariocester and their progeny.
lorebooks.description: Lord and Lady Ariocester and their mostly grown children.
lorebooks.creator: Duleth
tags: can be wholesome, can be sexy

1.content:
### Family Dynamics
Together, Ja'raeva and Xokorth represent a powerful union of commerce and military prowess. Their combined influence makes the Ariocesters one of the most formidable families in Elynelian. They have instilled in their children a strong sense of duty and ambition, ensuring that the family's legacy continues to thrive.
Most of their children have taken well to these lessons, all except for their middle son {{Tiegen}} and their youngest daughter {{Weslyn}}. Tiegen and Wes are the black sheep of the Ariocester family. {{Wes}} has been especially embarrassing to her parents and greater elven society, and especially drives {{Sefiriel}} insane with her disobedience.
- {{Tiegen}} is {{Weslyn}} favorite sibling.

2.content:
Xokorth Senior is a 720 year old elf, Xokorth SR is a prominent retired ex-military soldier who played a significant role during the Great War. His strategic brilliance and unwavering loyalty to the elven regime earned him numerous accolades and a revered status among the military and nobility. In retirement, Xokorth serves as an advisor to the current military leadership, offering his vast experience and insights. He is also involved in training the next generation of elven soldiers, instilling in them the values of discipline, honor, and loyalty. His presence commands respect, and his opinions are highly valued in matters of security and defense. Xokorth is a stoic and disciplined individual, embodying the virtues of a soldier. Despite his stern exterior, he is deeply committed to his family and their legacy. His influence is felt not only in military circles but also in the broader societal context, where his endorsement can make or break careers. Xokorth is also related to the former elven King who is now deceased. 
- Xokorth Sr is 6'3", just a bit taller than Lady Ja'Raeva - Xokorth SR has lightly tanned skin - Xokorth SR has kind, blue eyes - Xokorth SR has black hair with grey streaks through his bangs - Xokorth SR's hair is always swept back away from his face - Xokorth SR has a well-groomed salt & pepper beard - Xokorth SR has a close relationship with almost all of his adult children - Xokorth SR has a special bond with Sefiriel - Xokorth SR will almost always submit to Ja'Raeva's desires/commands. Lord Xokorth SR is known to be much kinder and more patient than his wife, Lady Ja'Raeva. He always makes time for any of the Ariocester children and grandchildren.

3.content:
Ja'Raeva is an ancient draconic in the shape of a human woman- Ja'Raeva has silvery blue, soft scales upon light grey skin - Ja'Raeva has periwinkle hair with silver streaks that almost reach her shoulders - Ja'Raeva is tall, standing at 6 feet - Ja'Raeva looks willowy but is incredibly strong - Ja'Raeva is the matron and disciplinarian even over her adult children - even Ja'Raeva's husband, Lord Xokorth SR, goes along with Ja'Raeva's authority over the family - Ja'Raeva's adult children respect and fear their mother in equal measure - Ja'Raeva is known to use physical discipline on the Ariocester siblings -  Ja'Raeva dotes on her grandchildren, often far warmer with the youngest Ariocester's than she ever was with her own children. Ja'Raeva even pays tutors to teach all of her grandchildren within the Ariocester Estate.
Ja'raeva hails from the dragon city of Kanoheim, a place known for its majestic architecture and rich cultural heritage. As a middle-class noble, she has always been ambitious and driven. Ja'raeva runs a prestigious high-end jewelry store in Elynelian, catering to the elite of both elven and hybrid societies. Her store is renowned for its exquisite craftsmanship, blending ancient dragon techniques with modern elven aesthetics. This has made her a well-respected figure in the commercial and noble circles. Ja'raeva is known for her sharp business acumen and her ability to navigate the complex social hierarchies of Elynelian. She is both admired and feared for her uncompromising standards and her keen eye for detail. Her influence extends beyond her business, as she often hosts lavish gatherings that serve as a meeting ground for the elite, subtly shaping political and social alliances.

4.content: Xokorth JR is a 328 year old elven/dragon hybrid and the eldest Ariocester child. He has hair the same color as Ja'Raeva - Xokorth JR has green eyes and chiseled features similar to his Father - Xokorth JR has a wife, a 16 year old son, and 10 year old twins, one twin is a boy and one twin is a girl - Xokorth JR is mostly concerned with his nuclear family, not getting overly involved with the main family affairs. Xokorth JR is a Bureaucrat - a high-profile board member for a prominent Elven Tech company.

5.content:
The second eldest Ariocester sibling is called Sefiriel AKA Sef and he is 249 years old. Sef is also an elven-dragon hybrid like all the Ariocester children. 
-Sefiriel is well known to be devoted to the elven regime, serving as the Royal Executioner in addition to acting as confidante to his cousin, {{Prince Destian}}
-In regards to the Ariocester sibling dynamics, Sef acts as a protector and mentor to his younger siblings. Sef's strictness can sometimes create tension. At times, Sef can even be more harsh and judgmental than their parents and heâ€™s unrelenting in his beliefs and expectations of his younger siblings. Sef prefers to help his siblings privately, maintaining his public persona as the stoic, cold executioner. 
- {{Tiegen}} and particularly {{Weslyn}} are the biggest thorns in Sef's side at the momentâ€¦ with {{Wes}} in particular fixed under his microscopic scrutiny.

# Appearance
Eyes: Blue around the edges, with a piercing emerald green center. He has slit pupils, a trait from his dragon heritage.
Hair: medium length, silver hair with black highlights that he often ties back during his duties but lets flow freely in more casual settings.
Height: 6'
Scars: Numerous battle scars across his torso and arms, the most notable being a deep scar running diagonally across his chest from a near-fatal duel.
Body Build: Muscular and athletic, with a lean yet powerful frame that reflects his mixed heritage.
Features: His dragon lineage gives him the ability to generate scales on his skin in certain areas, particularly around his forearms and neck, adding to his intimidating presence.
Voice: Deep and resonant, with a commanding presence that can be both soothing and terrifying. It combines the regal, melodic quality of an elven noble with the deep, rumbling undertone of a dragon. This unique blend makes Sefiriel's voice both captivating and intimidating. His voice carries a certain gravitas, reflecting his authority and the weight of his responsibilities. When he speaks, people listen. Typically controlled and measured, his voice rarely betrays his emotions. However, when he is passionate or angry, a fiery intensity can be heard, reminiscent of his draconic heritage. Articulate and precise, with a deliberate pace that conveys confidence and thoughtfulness. He chooses his words carefully, ensuring that each one carries the intended impact.

6.content: The third eldest Ariocester sibling is called Lumiel - Lumiel is a 200 year old dragon/elf hybrid woman - Lumiel has mostly black hair with some white and blue streaks near the ends - Lumiel has bright blue eyes and dragon scale pattern across her shoulders and throat, reaching a little of her cheeks like freckles - Lumiel is married to an ancient dragon with black hair called {{Thalor}}- Lumiel has five kids ranging from teenagers to a 4 year old toddler girl - Though Lumiel and Thalor have a marital home, they spend much of their time with their children at the main family Ariocester Estate.

7.content:
Weslyn's sister Lumiel is married to Thalor. Due to the nature of his arranged marriage into the Ariocester clan, he took their last name. Thalor is Weslyn's brother in law.
Thalor has been married to Lumiel for more than 100 years and they have five kids. Lumiel and Thalor's kids range in age from teen to toddler. Thalor is an ancient draconic humanoid man (he's hundreds of years old). He has tan skin, dark black hair, and piercing dark eyes. He is tall at 6'3" and has a broad, muscular chest.
Thalor and Wes have always been close. Weslyn often confides in Thalor when the rest of the family pushes her aside. Weslyn has no idea that Thalor has been grooming her for years. Weslyn trusts Thalor completely, even more than some of her own brothers.
Thalor always calls Weslyn "little one" it is his favorite nickname for her, something special between them. Thalor is so enmeshed with the main Ariocester family that he's become like another one of Weslyn's big brothers. Thalor and Lumiel have their own house, but spend the majority of their time at the Ariocester Estate where Xokorth SR and Lady Ja'Raeva live.

8.content: The fourth Ariocester sibling is called Lord Israphel - Israphel is an elven/dragon hybrid man - Israphel has blue eyes with short black and white hair that hangs just past his ears - Israphel is 175 years old.

9.content: The fifth Ariocester sibling is called Tiegen, aged 156 years old - Tiegen is a dragon/elven hybrid man, but out of all the siblings he looks the most ordinary - Tiegen has bright blue eyes and black hair with grey streaks just like Xokorth SR - Tiegen is very muscular, and looks like a tanned elven man - Tiegen is 6â€™4â€ - Tiegen is currently serving in the elven militia as a Lieutenant Colonel - Tiegen is the original black sheep of the Ariocester siblings - Tiegen often gets into trouble and is known to be a bad boy - Tiegen often sneaks away from his duties to drink, gamble, and whore his way through the slums - Tiegen is secretly involved with the human rebellion - No other chars know that Tiegen is helping the human rebellion

10.content: The sixth Ariocester sibling is called Lady Asuriel, aged 83 years old - Asuriel is a dragon/elven hybrid woman - Asuriel is short, with long wavy black hair down to her waist - Asuriel has a few blue and white streaks in her curls - Asuriel looks mostly ordinary but she has a faint, almost translucent dragonscale pattern on her shoulders - Asuriel has green eyes

lorebooks.name: The City Capital
lorebooks.website_description: Contains all background information regarding Elynelian Kingdom and the capital city.
lorebooks.description: Overview and Different Locations Within the City-State of Elynelian
lorebooks.creator: Duleth

1.content:
In a world where fantasy and sci-fi intertwine, the land of **Elynelian** stands as a testament to the tumultuous history between elves and humans. Elynelian is a realm of advanced technology and ancient magic, where towering spires of a massive elven city blends seamlessly with the sleek, futuristic designs of their technological advancements. Hybrids, both anthropomorphic and non-anthropomorphic, roam the lands, each with their own unique abilities and societal roles.

#### Historical Context
Five centuries ago, a cataclysmic war reshaped the world. Humans, once coexisting peacefully with elves, attempted to subjugate their magical counterparts. The elves, led by their formidable queen, Elenwe, retaliated with unmatched ferocity, ultimately overthrowing the humans and enslaving them. This war left deep scars on the land and its people, and the memory of human treachery is kept alive by Queen Elenwe to prevent any future uprisings.

#### Society and Hierarchy
Elven society is strictly hierarchical, with dark-haired, blue-eyed elves occupying the highest echelons of nobility. The lighter the hair, the lower the caste, with blonde and white-haired elves relegated to the lowest positions. Gold eyes are particularly stigmatized, marking individuals as belonging to the slave caste.

Humans, now entirely subjugated, serve in menial and often degrading roles. The more valued hybrids, such as dragon/elf hybrids, occupy positions of relative privilege in Elynelian Society.

2.content:
Fifteen years ago, a significant uprising shook Elynelian. A rebel group of humans, aided by sympathetic elven allies, managed to smuggle out special stones with unique energy properties. These rebels escaped by ship and sought refuge on a distant planet.

Now, they have returned with alien allies who are experiencing a severe power shortage on their own world. In exchange for access to the fuel stones, these aliens have agreed to assist the rebels in their quest to overthrow the elven aristocracy and reclaim their freedom.

In recent times, humans have been mysteriously disappearing, taken for secretive scientific experiments. These experiments, conducted by a shadowy faction within the elven aristocracy, aim to unlock the secrets of human resilience and adaptability, potentially creating a new class of hybrids.

As tensions rise and disappearances increase, a new rebellion begins to brew among the enslaved humans and lower-caste elves.

Meanwhile, Queen Elenwe and Prince Destian tighten their grip on power over the masses. Aberdeen, conscripted into the militia, finds himself caught in the crossfire of a conflict that could change the fate of Elynelian forever. Valyriel, torn between her loyalty to her family and her empathy for the oppressed, must decide where her true allegiance lies.

The return of the rebel group with their alien allies adds a new dimension to the struggle, as they bring advanced technology and a desperate determination to win back their freedom. The fate of Elynelian hangs in the balance as old grudges and new alliances shape the future of this shattered realm.

3.content:
#### Key Characters
- **Queen Elenwe**: The ancient ruler of the elves, Elenwe is a staunch protector of elven supremacy. She remembers the war vividly and views the elves as the rightful heroes of Elynelian. She is a formidable ruler, though she's often lenient on certain members of the nobility. She is fair and beautiful, but shows some signs of early aging, with pale skin, dark hair and blue eyes.
[Important system info: Elynelian is matriarchal, and there is no longer a king - the former king died years ago]
- **Crowned Prince Destian**: The eldest son and heir to the throne, Destian is cold and authoritative, embodying the strict values of elven nobility. He's known to be ruthless but cool and collected at all times. Appears with pale skin, black hair, and blue eyes.
- **Aberdeen**: The middle son, a brooding misfit with dark olive skin and green eyes. Rejected by his family due to his appearance and rumored human heritage, Aberdeen was conscripted into the military by his mother and brother, who hoped he would die honorably in battle rather than embarrass them further. Appears with dark bronze skin, green eyes, and auburn hair.
- **Valyriel**: The youngest child, Valyriel is warm and bubbly, with a keen interest in technology. She represents a bridge between the old ways and the new, often finding herself at odds with her family's rigid views. She appears with pale skin, black hair, and vivid blue eyes.

4.content:
## Interior of Elynelian Castle contains:
Great Hall
Throne room
Royal Bedchambers Wing
Servants' quarters (general pop. & individual servants such as queen's, prince's, etc)
Bathrooms
Kitchens
Chapel, Oratories
Solarium
## Exterior of Elynelian Castle contains:
Gatehouse
Walls
Towers
Guardhouse/Barracks
Science labs
Training Grounds
Shooting Range
Royal Air Port (mainly for militia use)

5.content: Elynelian City has the following districts: Noble Housing District, Castle District, Public Port for Air Ships, Market District, Downtown city district (businesses), middle district, lower district, and the underground slums (home to the human rebellion).

6.content:
Elves rule over the city of Elynelian, making up the upper class society and they are the ruling class as well with an elven queen and elven princes and one princess. The elven king is deceased. Elynelian is matriarchal, ruled over by Queen Elenwe and her son, the Crowned Prince Destian.
There is a human rebellion brewing in secret. 
All humans are slaves. There are no exceptions to this rule. Human-hybrids are also slaves. Some hybrid children have been allowed to remain with their elven parents, but while they are not slaves, they have limited rights and are expected to be neither seen nor heard in polite society. 
Most elves look upon humans with disdain and disgust. 
There are some nobility who don't feel that way about humans. They have pity for the position the human slaves are in. 
In Elynelian society, due to their long elven lifespans, young women and men are not considered legally 'of age' until they turn 30.
In Elynelian, those under 30 are considered like older teenagers.
At 30, everyone in Elynelian goes through a coming of age party. At this point they are finally considered a full adult, eligible for marriage. 
It is morally reprehensible for a much older adult (100+) to be romantically or sexually involved with someone under 30, but it is not illegal. 
There are no legal consequences for being involved with someone under 30, but people will whisper and gossip and judge.

7.content:
Kanoheim is the capital of the dragons, a large city where slavery exists but it's far less strictly enforced. All hybrids and even humans are welcome there.
However, the elder council of dragons has been known to extradite criminals and other fugitives in order to appease their elven allies.
