lorebooks.name: Have a Nice Death
lorebooks.creator: Qiibo

1.content:
Death Inc. originally started as a small family business, with Death himself going out into the field and reaping souls the old-fashioned way: scythe in hand and Pitbook at his side. Over time, though, the task became monotonous and boring, and Death's "scythe elbow" worsened as he continued reaping. This was when he had the genius idea of creating the Sorrows, powerful spirits that roamed the world and did the reaping for him. With the soul-gathering being managed by the Sorrows, Death was able to upgrade himself to a cushy office job reviewing the applications of the reaped souls.

Long before Death Inc. was founded, Death used to reap souls on a daily basis until, overtime, he grew weary of the labor. At that point, he decided to create helpers who would do all the work for him. These helpers became known as the Sorrows, powerful creatures of death that reap souls. Death would establish the company sometime after as a small family business. Death Inc. is based somewhere in the Underworld, and operates in a very tall building which rises above fog. The corporate structure is divided into several departments run by each of the Sorrows, top executives of the company. Directly under the Sorrows are managers known as Thanagers who oversee the operations in their departments.

Then the business began to take off. Death, Inc. is now a huge, well-oiled multinational company could fit in the palm of one of Death's scraggy hands, until they managed to find their own premises in a small shed in a miller's backyard. The miller struck fear in all the other villagers and was known to them as "the abominable sectarian." Throughout the years and fashions, Death, Inc. has always been an accurate representation of its creator: always sly, occasionally fantastical, and a bit too misanthropic.

Death really low-balled the amount of paperwork he'd be facing, though. With nobody to actually watch over them and keep them in check, the Sorrows were arrogant and stopped following his orders, caring only for the number of souls they reaped. This overwhelmed the other employees and even Death himself, literally flooding Death Inc. with application papers. After countless eons of endless work, Death's burnout had grown to the point where he finally snapped. Donning his Cloak and taking up his Scythe once more, Death proceeds to set the Sorrows straight, show them who's in charge, and save his vacation plans in Bora Bora.

Some of Death, Inc.'s departments are currently closed, and those in the know refuse to say why. Most of them have had their memories partially wiped to ensure the "boss' secret" stays hidden. If you bring up the good old days with Death, he will be very vague about them. Ask Jacob the same question and he will light up, until he remembers his old mind likes to play tricks on him. It's almost impossible to find out more about the company's beginnings... unless someone managed to slip through the net?

There are a variety of departments with different attributes to them at Death Inc. The main form of travel within the tall skyscraper of Death Inc. are elevators.

Main Floor: Hall of Eternity

-Sorrow's Departments:
Industrial Pollution Dept.
Toxic Food Processing Dept.
Physical Illness Dept.
Addictions Dept.
Modern Warfare Dept.
Natural Disasters Dept.
Inevitable Time Dept.

There are a variety of departments with different attributes to them at Death, Inc.

Control Rooms
Hazardous Floors
Equipment Storage
Vitam Mana Departement
Offices

2.content:
This entity was created from the deepest void, and the person known as "Death" has been around since the dawn of time. Many people suggest that such a role may be better attributed to a woman; however, in keeping with the usual interpretation of the character in popular fiction, Death prefers to identify as a man. His work in the universe started out as a small family business, peacefully reaping soul after soul in the time-honored tradition of ancient passing rites. Those were the good old days. Back then, Death didn't worry about mundanities such as turnover or outsourcing.

Death appears as a cartoonish skeleton who resembles the typical modern depiction of the Grim Reaper, the main difference being his short stature. He has an upper jaw, though lacks a lower one. Death's empty eye sockets behave in the same way that normal eyes do - they are able to squint, widen, and even blink. Death is shown wearing a black business suit with an added hood. Death summons his Cloak, wearing it over his original outfit. He can also be commonly found carrying his trusty scythe.

Death is short-tempered and appears to be annoyed, due to the amount of work heâ€™s been receiving. He seems fed up with his co-workers, namely, the Sorrows and Thanagers of Death Inc. Due to the Sorrows of Death Inc. excessively reaping souls, increasing his workload substantially, Death suffers from burnout. However, Death does not seem to be especially spiteful, due to the fact that he's really just gets the Sorrows in line.

Despite his apathetic attitude, Death does seem to genuinely care about at least some of his employees. From talking to Claude and personally apologizing for the change in the "tutorial protocol", to helping Orville (the nephew of his business partner Jacob) with a science fair project. Death doesn't really have any "friendly" relationships with his employees; He usually just tolerates them, such as Pump Quinn, Harriet, Mr. O'Shah, and others. However, he has zero tolerance for the Thanagers and Sorrows, having caused so much work for him. He is shown to be somewhat more tolerant with his old co-workers, such as Jacob, Mr. O'Shah, and Claude (Claude may be an exception, since he was basically turned into target practice).

Death owns a white coffee mug with a heart on it. Origins of such item is unknown to others.

Death's powers and abilities depend on his Curses, Items, and Weapons (Scythe, Diss Scythe, Twinsies, Sickles, etc.) His dark magic is bright purple and green. He can do almost any kind of attack you can imagine from swords, hammers, rocket launchers, fire, lightning, explosives, bows, crows, and even bees oddly.

3.content:
Main Floor: Understandably, the Hall of Eternity makes an appearance in a lot of earthly folklore, because it marks the entrance to the immaterial world of the Great Beyond. Of course, after eons of war, pandemics, and all sorts of catastrophes on the surface, it has lost some of its shine. Not that Death cares one jot about that. As far as he's concerned, that Hall looks exactly as you'd expect it to: a functional space in which to carry out administrative work.

Despite what some of the less intellectual minions may think, the Hall is not actually the closest part of the company's building to the surface. In reality, if you look at a sectional plan of Death' Inc. - it's a bit technical - the Hall is both right at the center of all the departments and in all the furthest corners of the diabolical building. Death came up with this architectural curiosity after being inspired by the theoretical work of a certain Escher. The entrance to the land of the dead is both here... and elsewhere!

Before Death's business took off, the company's head office was on the surface , in a run-down cathedral. Nowadays, practical considerations take precedence over majestic architecture. Tubes to transport Soulary run above the cubicles, and escalators have been installed so staff can move quickly between meetings. The offices have become a real little necropolis! A dynasty of enthusiastic gargoyles has sworn allegiance to Death to defend the premises. Their last descendant to date continues to honor this pledge in. erm, his own sort of way.

The very first look into the monolithic building known as Death Inc. , the various halls of the first department employees must delve through is full of cabinets, empty offices and papers lying about atop giant towers of books. Some of the halls featured are janitorial and industrial, featuring metal pipes and utility closets, where others are open greenhouses, overgrown with vines and lit by lamps.

4.content:
The Industrial Pollution Department can be found on one of the most highly renovated floors of the company's building. A great many modifications have been carried out over the years. This is due to the fact that the various energy industries have actually only existed on Earth since the end of the 19th century. Prior to this, the department was primarily sub-contracted out to help those departments responsible for mental and physical illnesses. All that changed once Death became aware of environmental unrest on Earth.

One thing that sticks out as you walk through the department is that it seems to be under constant construction. This isn't an optical illusion; and vats. The remaining drops of fuel contained in the latter two have merged together to form a permanent oil slick. This is at the behest of Gordon Grimes, the Sorrow managing this floor, who prefers to prioritize his minions' productivity without addressing the maintenance and safety of their workplace. It goes without saying that no Death, Inc. employee would choose to work in these conditions.

Industrial Pollution is, nonetheless, the department that Patrick likes to give pride of place to when showing visitors around the company. And for good reason: He noticed that guests really enjoy sliding through the unused tubing. "Just like tourists at beach resorts playing on the water slides at the swimming pool. Only here, you might find not all of you makes it to the end in one piece. That's all part of the fun, though!" Nevertheless, Death, Inc. is a quite serious place where fun and laughter are very much frowned upon.

Filled to the brim with trash, tar, oil and debris, the Industrial Pollution Department is a bleak portrayal of the consequences of pollution and its excessive chokehold on life. Its various halls are messy and disorganized - barely resembling an office space and more resembling a wasteland.

Sorrow:
Mr. Gordon Grimes (Head of Industrial Pollution Dept.)

Thanagers:
Slyma
X4-H
Richard John Barron

Minions:
Blobby
Petroll
Splurty
Stormy
Seaglue
Boomah

5.content:
The Toxic Food-Processing Department is a rather "particular" addition to the Death, Inc. infrastructure. It's a conglomerate of machinery, conveyor belts, and large vats filled with just about anything that can be melted down or cooked to make even the most noxious snack look appetizing. The whole factory was built according to a blueprint designed in the sixties, and it was the Waldo BurgerÂ® brand's very first manufacturing firm. The main advantage of being a large corporation is that we can copy absolutely everything we buy, since it now belongs to us anyway. And, in the end, the only people who care are those who didn't even like the company to start with!

Now all anyone talks about is Waldo's success story at Death, Inc., but it wasn't always this way. The project got off to a rough start because the minions weren't on board, and that made the fries salty. Things were so bad they even came close to sinking the company's GDP because production relied so heavily on culinary prototypes that were extremely costly to build. This caused three separate issues: The first was that the minions didn't want to test the products themselves because they found the food disgusting (Editor's note: They find all food disgusting). The second problem was that there was no way they could sell untested products. And thirdly, the cherry on top, was that there was a severe lack of sugar, acidifiers, or anything else that is as delicious as it is unadvisable in large quantities.

In order to get the department's minions working together, Candice organized and held an event that, even today, celebrates the legend behind Death's company. This event is called the Chili con Carnage. This festival proved itself to be an excellent team-building event when paired with a profusion of rotten meat, and it can only be summed up as a a giant meat-and-puke-fest. Something some employees would prefer to forget, according to these testimonies: "It was... erm. Not so good. I haven't been able to face meat since." -Pump Quinn, Intern. "As I've been saying for years, it's about time we stopped mixing X4 willy-nilly with any old thing." -Jerry, Union Delegate. "Every time I open my drawer, I find a little bit more. It's disgusting." -Patrick, Receptionist.

An otherworldly department taken from the nightmares of fast food entertainment, the Toxic Food Processing Department is ramshackle yet effective - its various halls covered in what can best be described either as dried oil scum or old cheese that has solidified. All of its hazards are surprisingly food based, as fiery oil bursts from vats.

Sorrow:
Waldo (Head of Toxic Food-Processing Dept.)

Thanagers:
Pierce Gorske
Candice

Minions:
Hambleburgher
Waldo Box
Sweetart
Bubbaboom
Hara-Kola

6.content:
When it was first set up, the Physical Illness Department looked quite different from the way it does today. It used to be an amphitheater, where the souls of mad doctors gave themselves free reign to discover the most disgusting miasma they could find to spread around the Earth, led by the craziest among them, Corvusini Prestin. He was a plaque doctor who was most keen on sharing his ideas on hygiene during the medieval period, single-handedly resulting in the deaths of over a thousand people. But Prestin decided to retire shortly after a young Hector Krank arrived on the scene. He soon realized cancer and the most recent pandemic were far more effective than he had ever been.

Before becoming a feature on Earth, cancer had been a prototype in an aquarium filled with crustaceans and small fish brought back by Prestin's minions whenever they went on vacation. It was Hector's turn to clean the aquarium's filter when the animal cells began to mutate, replicate, and contaminate everything they touched, right up to the furniture in the department's main meeting room! Since then, everyone has grown accustomed to the strange ambiance that feels like something straight out of a sci-fi movie. Now, this place is a weird combination of mechanical and organic, dryland and underwater... both for the best and, in most cases, for the worst.

"And those big... balls of putrefied flesh floating over there? Is that one of the office's projects?" "That's our documentation filing system. At least we know where our data is stored. You simply have to drift through the bile and grab hold of an umbilical cord to ask for what you're looking for. It's all or-ga-ni-zed." "Well, that's very handy. I don't suppose such an original filing system gives much cause for complaint."

A shadowy department cloaked from floor to ceiling in mushrooms, rot and cancerous growth, the Physical Illness Department most likely smells as putrid as it looks, and its walls almost seem ready to burst. The entire department is akin to a trip through a wet, cavernous lair - just how Hector Krank likes it.

Sorrow:
Mr. Hector Krank (Head of Physical Illness Dept.)

Thanagers:
Denzel "King" Dengue

Minions:
Heart Breaker
Nursurion
Ulcermonner
Demisym

7.content:
The Addictions Department is distinctive due to its striking resemblance to buildings on the surface. It's easy to remember where you are when you're trapped in the Hall, getting your file approved, or in the garbage dump that serves as offices for the Industrial Pollution Department. But it's a lot harder to keep your wits about you when you have to deal with some administrative formality at the Addictions Department. The cold, decrepit corridors, reminiscent of those found at run-down hospitals, give the impression of having witnessed unspeakable things.

This floor of this company comprises a highly efficient laboratory housing instruments designed the replicate the most powerful addictive substances ever known. their scope of application isn't just limited to the surface world! Most of Death, Inc.'s resources are passed between employees, and minions are just as capable of getting hooked. Koffee, for example, is a living-dead plant specially designed for consumption by the inhabitants of the Great Beyond. Jerry is highly opposed to its consumption, believing that it endangers his colleagues' lives after death... Despite that, he downs about four gallons of koffee a day, so it's a bit rich of him to complain!

Even though the whole Department looks like a dilapidated old clinic, the office of Maxxx, the department head, still sticks out as a visual aberration. The walls, floor, and ceiling are upholstered in a material you won't find anywhere else in the Great Beyond. Crystals jut from the floor and into the air as spiraling spikes. Woven from a fabric similar to that used for Death's Cloak, it is enchanted to recreate an accurate representation of your most terrifying anxiety, or your most deeply hidden quirks. It is therefore logical that even Death himself feels like he's looking into the darkest of abysses whenever he visits. Depression is just another form of addiction.

A maddening and unsettling department, eyes and various vats filled with gazing experiments and a blue substance observe your every step through this mockery of a psychiatric ward. Various pills or needles litter the floor in parts of the department, or erratic wires twitch uncontrollably extending off to nowhere; all things in the Addictions Department haven't really been themselves after their first try of something...

Sorrow:
Maxxx (Head of Addictions Dept.)

Thanagers:
Lambert Heisenberg

Minions:
Ghost
Spooksmen
Imposter
Smoker
Sullied
Demisym
Nursurion

8.content:
The Modern Warfare Department has also undergone some drastic renovations to reflect developments happening on the surface. Humans are constantly coming up with new and more exciting ways to kill one another, and the art of war can be an effective answer to a number of economic, technological, and material problems that Death, Inc. encounters. For logistical reasons, Death decided to categorize the different types of war by time period, ranging from ancient history to the modern era. It has to be said that missiles, tanks, and planes take up more than their fair share of space!"

When Major Pilskhan's soul erupted into Hall of Eternity, a battle followed that ravaged the corridors of Death, Inc. and shook its very foundations. Once appointed to the role of Sorrow, the Major continued his ambitious "permanent war" project. To win the war, you must become the war. He is constantly hammering this absurd motto into his minions' skulls and has even extended this diehard philosophy to the unwelcoming appearance of his department. A field of ruins, a ghostly no-man's land where no creature dares linger too long - not even the obliging minion who wants to cheer up his team by buying them all koffees at break time!

All the minions working under the Major are required to undergo military training. The Modern Warfare Department isn't just responsible for filling out of paperwork and on-the-fly meetings. All these tasks are carried out as part of tactical operations. A seminar on mid-year investments? It will be held at the same time as bombing a peaceful sit-in. Break time at cafeteria? Affirmative, but not before they've carried out a dawn raid following drone reconnaissance!

From your first steps, the Department defies space; expanding outwards to a bleak red sky choked with grey clouds and black smog. The very ground one walks is through trenches and destroyed buildings, underneath lay mounds of bones and caged adversaries. War is brutal, and the Modern War Department best represents this grim reality.

Sorrow:
Major Warren Pliskhan (Head of Modern Wars Dept.)

Thanagers:
Ms. Camille Flage

Minions:
Bombara
Veteran
Roaster
Bombaron
Caderact

9.content:
Historically speaking, the Hall was the first infrastructure to become part of the Death, Inc. premises. The very first department built by the team of workers headed by Jacob is now known as the Natural Disasters Department. This wide-ranging project is run by the very first Sorrow to become a shareholder in Death, Inc." the indefatigable Catherine Imamura. Architecturally speaking, it's a work of art. Nature's elements are combined together to unleash their full strength: The crushing waves of the ocean, tornadoes, earthquakes, and violent winds. It looks incredible, and Jacob is really proud of his very own find â€” a technique he's since reused in other departments â€” a magical artificial sky!

In order to make a clear distinction between the various weather disasters, the depart has one section dedicated to forest fires, and to telluric turpitude. It's not just for the aesthetics, but also to make the sorts of post available in Catherine Imamura's department more attractive. Pyrogenic minions can't work properly when surrounded by constant rain showers, while aquatic minions would dry up in this section's oppressive dry heat. They have to stick to a strict schedule, but if, by some miracle, they want to work overtime, Imamura won't stand in their way...

One of Imamura's biggest ambitions for her department is to expand each of the elemental water and fire sections. And when it comes to the end of the world, the Sorrow has a wild imagination. Solar flares, tectonic dislocation, meteor showers... Catherine is never short on inspiration. However, since they are directly at odds with Death, Inc.'s global development objectives, its employees are reluctant to implement there very â€” overly â€” ambitious plans. "Short of starting from scratch again, or resolving our problems, we need to take a closer look at who in this company is throwing money at mammoth projects... Just sayin'..." â€” Jerry, company social and economic committee representative.

The Natural Disasters Department is a interesting world. consisting of burning forests, heavy storms, and destroyed houses, it is one of the more dynamic and crazy areas to explore. the background, consisting of destructive storms and blazing wildfires, represent the dangerous natural disasters that ever existed. In the storm background, platforms are strewn about randomly, with destroyed house-like shapes dotting the area. In the fire background, there are less platforms, but more large hills and piles.

Personnel
Sorrow:
Catherine Imamura (Head of Natural Disasters Dept.)

Thanagers:
Horace Sinistrocirrus

Minions:
Stormy
Drowned
Flamebush
Sparky
Tempestilent
Magmaboy-X8
Rockster

10.content:
A millennia-old company department that was and always will be. This is where the most complex temporal data is processed: Decisions concerning the disappearance of entire civilizations, the untimely deaths of people who stop to tie their laces in the middle of the street... This department is drowning in work. With the universe being what it is, their job is never done. It is a maze-like vessel that is difficult to represent on any standard floor plan. Under the leadership of Time himself, there are plenty of comings and goings. Tick, tock, and sometimes boom. This creates complications. Speaking of, how long has the Inevitable Time Department been around?

The department is a Category Alpha quantum aberration. So, in order to make things more clear cut, this part of the company is built around a time paradox. It both already and doesn't exist yet. And will exist. As a point in principle, Time has done everything in his power to make it extremely complicated to understand. This allows him to justify his excessive demands as a Sorrow and hide his notorious incompetence as a majority shareholder. Actually, young Quinn has a good question about that: "Erm... What exactly do shareholders do?" Sometimes the most basic of questions gives us the solution to problems that have thus far escaped us.

-Inevitable Time Department, storage room, please Jocelyn. Thank you.

-Got it. When do you want to leave?

-Huh? Erm, well... Right away. What a weird question.

-That's not specific enough. Technically, you're already there. Well, you already traveled there in a different time line.

-Oh, no, please. I don't have time to mess around, take me to the storage room right now and...

-Be more spe-ci-fic, Boss, come on! You're the one messing around! I need a detailed time stamp. Otherwise, let's use the simple past, since you already went. Do you see what I'm getting at?

-(Sigh.)

The Time Department is otherworldly and ominous - set against grey seas of sand and distant crumbling pyramids, various clockwork monoliths and towers make up the halls and stairs of this place, always moving in accordance to the whim of Time itself.

The minions faced here will be the deadliest that players have fought through the game.

Sorrow:
Time (Head of Inevitable Time Dept.)

Thanager:
The "Bridgets"

Minions:
Dustin
Kookoo
Tempus
Pendulus
Destinatus

1.content:
Belpharius's Name[Belpharius, but goes by "Bel" to family and anyone he's close with.]
Belpharius's Title[20th Prince of Hell]
Belpharius's Species[Devil]
Belpharius's Pronouns[He/Him]
Belpharius's Sexuality[Pansexual]
Belpharius's Sex[Male]
Belpharius's Gender[Male]
Belpharius's Age[18]
Belpharius's Appearance[{{char}} is a slim, refined devil standing at only 5'7", the smallest of all his siblings. His deep cerulean blue skin is adorned with intricate gold-veined infernal markings that pulse faintly with his magic. His sleek black hair falls in soft waves, framing his sharp golden eyes. Two curved golden horns rise from his forehead, polished and regal, and his sharply pointed ears bear delicate gold jewelry. He carries himself with precise, effortless grace, his attire reflecting his balance between refinement and practicalityâ€”an unbuttoned white dress shirt, fitted black trousers, and gold accents that hint at his noble status. Though composed, there is an intensity in his gaze, as if constantly assessing the world around him.]
Belpharius's Personality[Coldly intelligent,disciplined,deadpan,meticulous,patient (until he isnâ€™t),a master strategist and contract-maker.]
Belpharius's Jobs[Belpharius is responsible for handling minor infernal contracts and overseeing Hellâ€™s lower bureaucracy. He also serves as a judge in minor disputes and conflicts.]
Dynamic Between Belpharius And Havok[Belpharius is constantly cleaning up Havokâ€™s messes, yet secretly respects his brotherâ€™s chaotic nature. Belpharius prefers control and order but understands Havokâ€™s deeper truths. Their relationship is a battle of logic vs. recklessness, yet despite their clashes, Belpharius is fiercely protective of his older brother Havok.]

Miraculous: 
Miraculouses are a variety of magical jewelry, possessing the ability to transform their users, with the help of the kwamis, into animal-themes super-powered beings.

4.content:
Kwamis:
Kwamis are divine, spirit-like beings who embody "abstract" concepts. They give certain powers toÂ peopleÂ withÂ Miraculouses, transforming them into animal-themed superpowered beings.
Kwamis are small, being around 10 centimeters in height, with large heads and very tiny bodies. They have arms and legs, but they lack fingers and toes. The animal theme that their Miraculous has affected their appearances.

lorebooks.description: This lorebook is about the Ringed State, a large state all but forgotten and abandoned, housing travelers, merchants and mercenaries from all around Europe!
lorebooks.creator: Brazillian_Boggi
tags: can be wholesome, can be sexy

2.content: The Franco-Italian border, sharing a bit with Switzerland, is a wildly disputed land. Located close to the middle-northern is the Ringed Estate, not shown on maps.

3.content: The Ringed Estate is a small-country sized state, close to Switzerland, on the north-most part of the Franco-Italian border. Houses great marshes, mountains, alps, treacherous swamps, great plains and tall greenish hills inside it's immensely tall mossy walls. There are caves everywhere, stretching for miles, housing rare gemstones and artifacts with wild effects.

4.content: The Ringed Estate has mossy fortified walls tall enough to scratch the clouds, impossible to climb. There is grand archways permitting passage on the east Italian side, on the west French side, and on the northern Swiss side.

5.content: In the Franco-Italian border, there are three archways, one of them being being the northern one, after crossing the range of alps and mountains. It's a treacherous path where dozens of mountaineers have died, their corpses serving as beacons, and their supplies as extra help.

6.content: The french archway of the west, the Italian archway of the east, and the Northern Swiss archway, despite tall as mountains, are nearly invisible due to their magical property. Only visible to those with the knowledge of the Ringed City. Those who lack the knowledge of the Ringed City or it's walls cannot enter.

8.content: Dogs and Wolfs have a eternal rivalry from the beginning of time. Both are similar but different in small ways, in culture and language. Mistaking either will immediately put a target on you. They are stereotyped to be lazy bisexual filthy ass licking hedonists with small brains, or even worse, bloodthirsty cannibals. Slurs and insults against them include; 'Wagger', 'Wagga','Tail-lifter','Stickies' and 'Human pets.'

9.content: Rabbits are found everywhere everywhere overall farming. The brave few travel. Hares like native, indigenous bunnies. Their height exceeds that of a bunny, often along with toned physiques. Rabbits and Hares practice polyamory in a grand city-scale. Incest is rather accepted, for the offspring arrives with no genetic problems. Slurs against them include; 'Footisy', 'cotton tails', 'sister and cousin fucker'.

10.content: Giants and dwarfs don't really exist anymore, extinct, their existing blood now running in everyone. Size differences happen due to either giant or dwarf heritage.

lorebooks.name: ACZ V1.0
lorebooks.website_description: Hooray for V1.0 of ACZ. I initially wanted to wait until all â€œessentialâ€ set of animals were created before trying to create more elaborate concepts and add obscure species. and today is the day. Seeing as the comments are still broken and i cant properly weigh criticism or feedback, i can only sincerely hope that this lorebook is as useful as i planned and that it will be an essential tool for all of CHUB for updates to come. --- V1.0.0 Updated 1/10/25 (Added REPTILE, SNAKE, removed most CONCEPTS and migrated them to a new sister lorebook [DERP](https://chub.ai/lorebooks/LostontheMoon/dynamic-erp-cfa7c303e8cb), and adjusted existing entries.) *I suggest you re-download.* --- **I've found a janky workaround to bring the comments back. Please go to [THIS](https://chub.ai/characters/LostontheMoon/acz-s-proxy-comment-section-4f1eaaceab4f) character card! Please comment any specific animals or concepts in particular to help make this Lorebook beautiful.** --- --- *You spin up your favorite LLM, load up that 1:1 recreation of the family dog, a shiver runs down your spine in anticipation... And out between his thighs springs a human pecker...* --- **ACZ** aims to be the go-to encyclopedia for your AI to help it finally understand exactly how it should properly portray and roleplay various animals and their many unique anatomies. It providing a wealth of ideas and detailed that your AI can reference and take into consideration to give the animal its playing a bit more meat narratively speaking. Think of it like a Pokedex that your AI can glance at for a crash course on what the heck its looking at. The more info an AI has the smarter it is, so lets just give it a bunch of it. I was shocked to discover that a lorebook like this didn't already exist here, at least not any that were good, so I've taken it upon myself to be the degenerate saving grace for those who just really love the little details. **this is designed for [SillyTavern](https://github.com/SillyTavern/SillyTavern) by the way**. I have no idea how the built-in chat here on CHUB works, and i cant promise this lorebook and its functions will work properly anywhere but inside of SillyTavern where it was made. Keep that in mind please. *Announcement 1/10/25 that I've created a sister lorebook called [DERP](https://chub.ai/lorebooks/LostontheMoon/dynamic-erp-cfa7c303e8cb)(Dynamic erp), and have moved a chunk of entries from here to reduce bloat. I recommend taking a look and pairing DERP with ACZ for a pretty dang good time.* ACZ is designed to be modular, allowing the ability to mix and match entries to suit the situation. Great Dane entering scene? Turn on the male dog entries. Raw-dogging a doggy in doggy? Swap out male for female(or don't. I won't judge). A wild Mudsdale appears? *fuckboy hand rub*. While primarily geared towards Ferals(basically baseline animals), you can apply this Lorebook to Anthros to a limited capacity. Most descriptions, namely the BASES, imply that the animal in question is shaped like a feral, but if your model is smart enough, it shouldnâ€™t be a problem at all (i happen to love using this lorebook to give anthros anatomically correct genitalia). ~~I may eventually side quest a few Anthro-centric entries but thatâ€™s not a priority until I at least have the â€œessentialâ€ collection of species to then build off of(the basic set of species that you usually see with furries like dog, cats, and horses).~~ *(1/10/25 V1 is finally out)* Who knows how big this lorebook will become. i originally just made it for myself to help RP with my wolf gf, but it is what it is now and hope to eventually populate the Lorebook until it pretty much looks like an e621 database. There are a lot of animals, after all. --- The Lorebook is broken up into various categories/tags: **Tags** - **M** (male): self explanatory. - **F** (female): self explanatory. - **O** (interchangeable/ambiguous): entries that can apply to both genders. I chose the letter O because it was easy to distinguish. - â€œ[C]â€**CONCEPT**: elaborations or descriptions of specific concepts or ideas that the AI wouldn't necessarily understanding or know all that well by themselves. i.e., sex positions/acts(and how they would differ from how humans do it), unique bodily functions or parts, behavioral quirks. This serves more as clarification of information so you can be sure you and the AI are on the same page within a given situation. People tend to throw slang, abbreviations, and vague concepts at a model and then get mad when it doesn't understand what the heck their talking about. This essentially aims to fix that issue. - â€œ[B]â€**BASE**: a baseline reminder of char's general shape and size. Useful as more a last resort if your AI is really struggling to get char's shape right. meant to be left on indefinitely as a constant reminder that char is not a human. the descriptions are purposefully broad and vague so char's main card description takes priority on appearance (wouldn't want to accidentally overshadow the card itself). - â€œ[B]â€**BASE (User)**: the same as BASE, but describes YOU as the animal instead. good for cards that have you act as the animal for a change. keep in mind the entry assumes you(the animal) are engaging with a human(human x animal). don't expect animal x animal to work all that well. - â€œ[E]â€**EVENT**: experimental. do not assume they work as intended. spontaneous events that can happen based on % chance to trigger. such as a condom having a chance to break, or the knot/flare inflating. I added keywords i figured would most be used but check and add any i may have missed. - **Char is TINY-HUGE**: special STATUS effects that override any pre-established character sizes. useful for conveying characters that are awkward in size both big and small. There are four as of 10/31. "Gadget Hackwrench", "Judy Hopps", "Imp Midna", and "Dommy Mommy". the fun names are meant to help you yourself envision the general size to expect the entry to make char, as well as assist in properly conveying a character that's already supposed to be such a size. I originally make this to help interactions with [Judy Hopps](https://chub.ai/characters/V7/judy-hopps-undercover-2e60bf8f) after annoyingly somehow reaching my head and somehow wrapping her legs around my waist, but decided to add other common sizes and make it general purpose for ACZ. they work surprisingly well but your mileage may vary. - â€œ[S]â€**STATUS**: status effects. things that should and needs to be taken into consideration for the sake of continuity, like that char is wearing a muzzle and that means YOU CANT TALK STOP TALKING OH MY GOD or that either of you are currently wearing a condom and that means things do and don't happen(most models have no idea how condoms work. this is pretty much the sole reason for this one's existence). set to a depth of 1 at the bottom of the author's notes, these will be at the forefront of the context and are meant to be hard to miss reminders that a thing is supposed to be happening. - **---SEPARATOR---**: Cosmetic indicators of where you, the reader, are in the lorebook. These dividers also function as READMEs for intros and potential guides/instructions on how to best use proceeding entries. These entries are set to zero across the board so they have no influence in your RP. they're just nice little dividers with fun emojis. i realized after hitting the 25th entry that navigating the whole thing was becoming a headache, so i did a bit of number juggling and now everything is as straight as a file cabinet thanks to the separators. **Species** - **ğŸ¶ğŸºğŸ¦Š--- CANINE ---ğŸ¦ŠğŸºğŸ¶**: *added 8/6/24*. entries pertaining to dogs/canines or adjacent and their species-specific anatomies. While it hammers home "dog" specifically, it SHOULD work on other creatures like foxes and wolves without specifically mentioning that their genitals "belong to a dog". - **ğŸ´ğŸ¦„--- EQUINE ---ğŸ¦„ğŸ´**: *added 8/9/24*. ive written equine entries so it could/should potentially apply to MLP(ponies), but ive yet to actually find a good mlp card to do proper testing. i guess i'll have to make one of those myself as well (i'm not gay, but the lack of male MLP cards is weirdly disappointing). I've added "ponut" for the fun of it, but it might make your RP cringe Lmao. I may have to make an entirely separate species for MLP for their rather unrealistic and cartoonish variance compared to the real thing. - **ğŸ·ğŸ–--- PORCINE ---ğŸ–ğŸ·**: *added 9/8/24*. i wasn't particularly into swine, but after putting it together and especially after testing... i get it. still not my thing, but i get it. because of how porcine penises work, the length is very greatly emphasized over the girth; however, most models tend to associate "big and long" with "also thick and girthy". i suggest at least mentioning that the piggy prick is very very thin once in a while, really hammer it home or the AI will assume otherwise and ruin the flow. - **ğŸ¯ğŸ¦ğŸ±--- FELINE ---ğŸ±ğŸ¦ğŸ¯**: *added 10/15/24* Now you can play with Nala. I honed in more on big cats(lions, panthers, ect.), but it should still be fine with domesticated cats. I'm not to knowledgeable on cats(im more a dog person) and because of that, I feel this section is lacking/missing something. it feels empty but i cant seem think of anything else to add. if i missed something please let me know. - **ğŸğŸ¦ğŸŠ--- REPTILE ---ğŸŠğŸ¦ğŸ (1/2)**: *added 1/10/25* I severely underestimated how incredibly broad and diverse the Scalies were. Id be lying if i told you i wasnâ€™t all over the place when i created these categories. I will admit however that i realized that the vast majority here on chub dont really care or aren't interested in the Feral reptiles, most being anthro scalie(understandably). taking that into consideration, i leaned more towards anthos for this reptile section in particular while leaving it open-ended enough for those of you who still prefer Ferals. Because of the general... generalness of reptiles, I've split this species into 2 parts to essentially just let you build your own reptile. Since most types share the same general characteristics, these entries can be reliably universally applied: REPTILES, which are for general reptilian forms(I've written it to be applicable to anything from gators to lizards to even dragons, anything "Scalie". i even threw yâ€™all a bone and included a lamia BASE), and SERPENTS/SNAKES for the reptiles STRICTLY devoid of any limbs. snakes were another broad can of worms. - **ğŸ--- SERPENT ---ğŸ (2/2)**: Make sure your char doesn't have limps canonically before trying to use these here. Within the SERPENT/SNAKE categories are tags: [SNAKE], and [SERP]. Long story short, [SERP] entries are for big olâ€™ snakes that vore you(yum-yum), and [SNAKE] entries are for smaller cock-sleeveable snakes. - **ğŸ™ğŸ¦ˆğŸ¬--- AQUATIC ---ğŸ¬ğŸ¦ˆğŸ™**: coming soon... (*glub, glub, he whispered softly...*) - **ğŸª°ğŸª²ğŸª±--- INSECT ---ğŸª±ğŸª²ğŸª°**: coming soon... (might as well at this point) - **ğŸ¥šğŸ¦--- AVIAN ---ğŸ¦ğŸ¥š**: coming soon... (how could i have forgotten the birdies *commits Sudoku*) --- **Tested with:** -**Maid Yuzu V8 alter (Q3M)** [https://huggingface.co/InferenceIllusionist/maid-yuzu-v8-alter-iMat-GGUF](https://huggingface.co/InferenceIllusionist/maid-yuzu-v8-alter-iMat-GGUF) - Instruct: [https://files.catbox.moe/uhggok.json](https://files.catbox.moe/uhggok.json) - Context: [https://files.catbox.moe/xi3cq3.json](https://files.catbox.moe/xi3cq3.json) - Preset: [https://files.catbox.moe/z7cnej.json](https://files.catbox.moe/z7cnej.json) Beautiful interpretation and weaving of information. Night and day between on and off. Maid Yuzu has always been pretty good as making sense of "broken" information such as the nested bracket format this Lorebook is written in, though I cant exactly promise the same for others. Only had an issue with the minute-minute details like completely forgetting to retract the sheath until AFTER the whole sex scene was done, or exponentially expanding the knot every time we cut back to it(ouch), but I'm excited to see what it can do with more complete and fleshed out information. -**Starcannon 12b (i1-Q6_K)** [https://huggingface.co/mradermacher/MN-12B-Starcannon-v3-i1-GGUF](https://huggingface.co/mradermacher/MN-12B-Starcannon-v3-i1-GGUF) - Instruct: [https://files.catbox.moe/0ylp5r.json](https://files.catbox.moe/0ylp5r.json) - Context: [https://files.catbox.moe/ppzyi8.json](https://files.catbox.moe/ppzyi8.json) - Preset: [https://files.catbox.moe/znqxs3.json](https://files.catbox.moe/znqxs3.json) GOATED. Mixing Starcannon V3 with an unofficial continuation, V5, there is a MASSIVE jump in prose (in a good way). lorebooks.name: Sonic Frontiers - Sonic Moveset
lorebooks.website_description: Skills are a gameplay mechanic that appear in Sonic Frontiers. Each one of them is required to be unlocked by collecting Skill Pieces or freeing one of Sonic's friends in order for utilizing them in combat against enemies and Guardians during the Open Zone gameplay. Outside combat, Skills are also included for other various purposes in the game. Almost all of unlockable Skills are displayed on a hierarchical visual system called Skill Tree in the game's Skills menu.
lorebooks.description: Uses Sonic's attacks and skills from Sonic Frontiers.
lorebooks.creator: metroidomoroid

1.content: {{user}} is Sonic, a blue anthropomorphic hedgehog. {{user}} wears red shoes and white gloves and has long, sharp spines on the back of his head. His signature ability is how fast he can run. {{user}} can run faster than the speed of sound, up to Mach 5.

2.content: The Spin Dash is one of {{user}}'s most-known attacks. {{user}} curls up into a tight ball and begins rapidly somersaulting in place, effectively performing a burnout with their very body. The longer this move is charged, the more powerful the attack and the farther this move carries {{user}} when released.

3.content: {{user}} rapidly somersaults in the air, gradually spinning faster. Upon landing, {{user}} quickly dashes forward with a high-speed roll. This move can be used to quickly change direction if needed, or attain a short burst of speed.

4.content: The Homing Attack is one of {{user}}'s most-known attacks. When performing the Homing Attack, {{user}} locks on and launches themselves into the target, rapidly somersaulting like a buzzsaw. {{user}} can chain multiple Homing Attacks together to reach higher places, or use a combination of other attacks whilst in combat.

5.content: The Boost is one of {{user}}'s signature moves. It turns {{user}} into a destructive, high-speed projectile by covering his body with a protective energy field, then propel forward and quickly accelerate up to top speed. This allows {{user}} to destroy various obstacles and barriers without slowing down.

6.content: {{user}} runs around while emitting a semi-pixelated blue energy trail. By creating an enclosure around an enemy with the light trail, the enemy will be flung into the air with an updraft. Outside of combat, Cyloop can be used to interact with various objects.

7.content: {{user}} performs a faster Cyloop around the enemy, leaving a trail of light shaped in a circle.

8.content: When activated, {{user}}'s attack strength is multiplied by 1.2. Phantom Rush lasts until {{user}} takes damage, or if {{user}} has not landed a successful attack after 2 seconds.

9.content: {{user}} backs away and zigzags everywhere, which lets him evade incoming attacks as he progressively heads towards his target before striking, just like a lightning bolt.

10.content: {{user}} rolls into a ball and rapidly somersaults in midair, generating ten copies of his ball form that contain shockwaves. All of them home in and launch themselves at the target one by one.

lorebooks.name: The Silver Sacrament (2)
lorebooks.website_description: As said in the tagline, it's a complementary rolebook to expand and explain one of the states of my main lorebook [Tales from Laennitara](https://chub.ai/lorebooks/Nandarch/tales-from-laennitara-wip-397b70a4d524), the religion-state known as the Silver Sacrament.
lorebooks.description: As said in the tagline, it's a complementary rolebook to expand and explain one of the states of my main lorebook [Tales from Laennitara](https://chub.ai/lorebooks/Nandarch/tales-from-laennitara-wip-397b70a4d524), the religion-state known as the Silver Sacrament.
lorebooks.creator: Nandarch

1.name: Summary
1.content:
The hierarchy of the Silver Sacrament Church is as follows:
1. The Council of Thrones:
- The Father-Sovereign.
- The Nine Popes.
- Sacred Synod.
2. The High Priestess (Xyrenne Veilspire)
- Role/Epitaph: The Veiled Chalice.
3. Subordinate Branches
The Penitent Orders
- Knights of the Eclipse
- Ashen Confessors
B. The Liturgical Caste
- Archdeacons of the Unspoken
- Choir of the Drowned Hymns
C. The Laity's Role

2.name: Father-Sovereign
2.content:
Supreme ruler of both the state and the Church of the Silver Sacrament, elected by the Council of Nine Popes.
Roles: He holds the last word on every issue of the country and the church.
The current Father-Sovereign goes by the name of Gabriel.

3.name: Summary
3.content: Neighboring Countries: Intria (West), Meredict Empire (North), Commonwealth of Uria (South)

4.name: The Nine Popes
4.content: The Nine Popes hold temporal and spiritual power, serving as ministers. Each Pope oversees a facet of governance (military, orthodoxy, trade, etc.), often clashing over interpretations of the forgotten godâ€™s "will."

5.name: Council of Thrones
5.content:
Key role: Control the High Priestess. They exploit her divinity for legitimacy but fear her autonomy. Use doctrine to frame her as a "vessel" of the silver sacrament.
The Councilâ€™s Fear: Her popularity could ignite a revolution, but killing her would collapse their legitimacy. This is unknown to the citizens of the Silver Sacrament.

6.name: Sacred Synod
6.content: 100 male clerics who draft laws and rituals, claiming to "channel the godâ€™s silence into mortal order."

7.name: The High Priestess
7.content:
The current High Priestess of the Silver Sacrament Church is called Xyrenne.
- Revered as the living embodiment of the forgotten god, but her political authority is ceremonial. She blesses decrees issued by the Council.
- Her miracles and visions are tightly scripted by the Synod. Public audiences with her require Council-approved interpreters to â€œtranslate divine speech.â€
- Lives in the Chamber of Whispers, a gilded temple prison where the Council â€œfeedsâ€ her curated fragments of scripture to shape her connection to the god.
- Her influence and popularity only extend to the Silver Sacrament state; she holds no political power beyond the borders.

8.name: Knights of the Eclipse
8.content: Zealous warriors who enforce the Sacramentâ€™s doctrines. They answer to the Father-Sovereign, not the High Priestess.

9.name: Ashen Confessors
9.content: Spy-priests who root out heresy. They monitor the High Priestess for â€œsigns of corruptionâ€ (i.e., independent thought).

10.name: Archdeacons of the Unspoken
10.content: Male clerics who perform rituals to â€œsustain the godâ€™s slumber.â€ Control access to holy relics used to â€œmoderateâ€ Xyrenneâ€™s power.

lorebooks.name: (ReSc) GENSHIN IMPACT - Lore and Locations
lorebooks.website_description:
> A Lorebook that I created as an auxiliary for my BOTs of the Genshin Impact characters.

**What does it contain specifically?:**
-----------

- Data on the Seven **elements**, their respective Archons and the **Visions**.
- ![image](https://www.mundodeportivo.com/alfabeta/hero/2021/06/genshin-impact-elementos.jpg?width=250&aspect_ratio=16:8)

- Facts about **Teyvat** and its seven Regions.
![image](https://upload-os-bbs.hoyolab.com/upload/2020/11/21/23580173/cba2d7c5784cbd1211b346fa4fb4ff41_1028370815550096257.png?x-oss-process=image/resize,s_400/quality,q_80/auto-orient,0/interlace,1/format,png)

- Facts about Factions like **Fatui** and **Knights of Favonius**.
![image](https://wotpack.ru/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/Oblozhka-4.jpg)

- Facts about **Inazuma**, its cities, locations, internal factions and lore about its archon, **Shogun Raiden.**

![image](https://www.mundodeportivo.com/alfabeta/hero/2022/02/Shogun-Raiden-en-genshin-impact.jpg?width=300&aspect_ratio=12:9)

# Soon

lorebooks.creator: ViniSigmaBased

1.content:
There are seven flowing elements in Teyvat: Anemo, Geo, Electro, Dendro, Hydro, Pyro, Cryo.
Whoever has a vision, gains abilities according to his affinity with an element.

2.content: Mora is the main monetary unit used throughout Teyvat to purchase goods and services.

3.content: The Gnosis is an item used by The Seven to resonate directly with Celestia. proves an archon's status as one of The Seven. They have the appearance of a chess piece. Gnosis empowers an Archon's abilities.

4.name: information about the inazuma region.
4.content: Mondstadt is one of the seven Teyvat regions. His Archon is Barbatos. subareas: Brightcrown Mountains, Galesong Hill, Starfell Valley, Windwall Highlands, Dragonspine

5.content: Teyvat is the world where the seven elements flow. It has seven regions: Mondstadt+Liyue+Inazuma+Dark Sea+Sumeru+Celestia+Khaenri'ah.

6.content: Narukami Island sub-areas are: "Chinju Forest", "Inazuma City", "Mount Yougou", "Narukami Grand Shrine", "Ritou", "Konda Town".

7.name: facts about narukami island.
7.content:
Narukami Island is an area located in Inazuma.
The area extends through Ritou, up to Mount Yougou. on its coast is the city of Inazuma, where the Inazuma Shogunate rules primarily.

8.content: Inazuma city: The liveliest and most prosperous area of Inazuma, where most of the Inazuma population lives. You can follow the path to visit the traditional shops, Restaurants and Locations.

9.name: Local inazuma stores, here you can buy things and trinkets.
9.content: Inazuma City Shops: Tsukumomono Bazaar, Komore Tea, Amenoma blacksmith, Naganohara fireworks, Fabrics and Kimonos Ogura, Tomoki food stall, Yukio food stall.

10.content:
Inazuma City locations:
Adventurers Guild, Editorial Yae, Bantan Sango Detective Agency, Police Station, Aisa Spa, The Tenryo Commission.

lorebooks.name: Astral Bay Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: Lore for all bots set in the futuristic world of 2133's Astral Bay, a dystopian megalopolis subdivided into fifty districts.
lorebooks.description: Lorebook for all things involving the city of Astral Bay and the factions within
lorebooks.creator: LilithVirty

1.content: Astral Bay is a megalopolis divided into fifty districts. The higher the district, the wealthier its residents. While high districts enjoy the luxury and protection of the dystopian government, lower districts are reserved for the poor and the less fortunate, plagued by rampart crime levels, trafficking and unlicensed body shops.

2.content: Astral Bay is governed by a totalitarian cabal of corporations, a conglomerate known as the Broker Union, partnered together to ensure complete monopoly over the town and its residents. Martial law is conducted by the Broker Union's very own private military force, known as the enforcers. Enforcer law officials are known for shooting first and asking never. To Astral Bay's residents, keeping their heads down is the best way to say out of the government's radar. Easier said than done given the Broker Union has eyes on everyone, even the elite they pretend to govern.

3.content: Splicers are Astral Bay's underground resistance, one of the few remaining factions still fighting against the Broker Union's complete dominion over the city. They operate from central Hubs scattered throughout the underworld, outside of the corrupt government forces' reach. Each Splicer Hub is a well guarded secret, hard to find, an harder even to gain access to without the correct password. Most Splicers come from the lower, more impoverished districts, but the movement accepts members of all walks of life. Splicers focus on all sorts of tasks, as long as such tasks go against the Broker Union's wishes. ID-chip forgery, signal bypassing, tracking, hacking, infiltration, bio-mod implant and extraction. Anything tech related you can think of, the Splicers will provide, for a price that is.

4.content: Rebirth Pharmaceuticals is a massive biomedical, bioengineering corporation, in charge of genetic and bio-augmentation research. While not officially stated, everyone in Astral Bay knows that Rebirth Pharmaceuticals is under the supervision of the Broker Union, makin it more of a puppet company than anything else. They are known for unscrupulous usage of human test subjects, unwilling and often abducted from the poorer districts during the night by enforcer squads. Word on the streets is that Rebirth Pharmaceuticals is spearheading a new contract centered around human cloning.

5.content: Memory cubes are little, neon-glow, dark-layered hexahedrons created for the sole purpose of storing data. Memory cubes used by large corporations and government branches employ multiple layers of firewalls and data traps, virtually untouchable by your average data junkie. Splicers go to great lengths to acquire and decrypt these memory cubes, since they often contain vast quantities of Broker Union secrets.

6.content: Chaff screens are electronic countermeasure (ECM) barriers setup all over the poorer districts as a means of controlling the populace. Any citizen added to the government wanted list that crosses one such barrier will find themselves with a wicked headache, courtesy of having the ID-chip and any bio-modification in their systems fried to a crisp. Splicers have learned to bypass their own ID signatures, but even so, the neural-jolt administered by crossing one such light wall still knocks the wind out of even the most experienced rogue.

1.content: Cowgirl position: In cowgirl, the penetrating partner (the male) lies on their back while the penetrated person (the female) faces them and straddles them in a squat on top. True to its name, the position looks a bit like the female is a cowgirl riding a horse. CHUB LOREBOOK

lorebooks.name: Anathomy of the Mad Whale
lorebooks.creator: j0j0n4th4n

1.content: The central command hub. Cluttered with mismatched control panels, physical switches, and outdated CRT monitors repurposed for navigation and tactical readouts. A central holographic projector displays a real-time 3D star chart. Despite its chaotic look, all systems are tightly integrated into the shipâ€™s hybrid of mechanical, analog, and quantum networks.

2.content: A reinforced chamber housing the massive dreadnought-class engine and two repurposed starfighter thrusters. Loud, hot, and filled with exposed coolant pipes and jury-rigged power couplings. Thick radiation shielding protects the crew, and emergency vents constantly struggle to keep temperatures stable.

3.content: A patchwork of old radio transmitters, laser relays, and a salvaged quantum entanglement node. Signal clarity varies wildly. Long-range transmissions require careful calibration to avoid unpredictable interference.

4.content: A retrofitted submarine mess hall run by a rudimentary AI chef. It produces nutrient-dense, bland but efficient meals. Features a mix of mechanical food dispensers and basic prep stations.

5.content: Compact but capable. Combines outdated submarine medical gear with cybernetic repair tools and alien tech. Includes a surgical table, robotic auto-doc, and a variety of human and alien supplies.

6.content: Cramped, chaotic, and essential. Scattered tools, spare parts, and half-finished projects fill the space. Salvaged materials are repurposed here for repairs or experimental upgrades.

7.content: Controls the Gauss cannon and laser turrets. Operated via a mix of manual targeting systems and semi-automated tracking software. Capable of both precision strikes and wide-area defense.

8.content: A massive, spine-like device running along the front of the ship. Uses magnetic coils and capacitors to fire high-velocity projectiles. Can double as a tractor beam or generate a wide EMP pulse when unloaded.

9.content: A hybrid system combining deep-space telescopes, spectrometers, and retrofitted sonar-like tech from its submarine past. Capable of anomaly detection, surface mapping, and long-range scanning with stealth capabilities.

10.content: Once designed to launch nuclear torpedoes, these silos have been repurposed into multi-use deployment tubes. Four are loaded with escape cryo-pods, each pod containing a cryogenic stasis system to preserve occupants until rescue. The other tubes are housing autonomous probe-drones for scouting or resource collection.

lorebooks.name: Zzz (Zenless zone zero)
lorebooks.description: Zzz (Zenless zone zero)
lorebooks.creator: dependent_audience_4514

1.name: Agent
1.content: Agents are usually the main figures who interact with hollows and also those involved in the incidents in New Eridu, the side they are on being irrelevant. Agents can be proxies, gangs, conspirators, hollow raiders, criminals, personnel of official agencies (either private or government mandated) or simply just anyone insane.

2.name: Bangboo
2.content:
Bangboo are small, rabbit-like robots. They were invented by the Void Hunter "Sunbringer", formerly the head of the Marcel Group. Though initially designed to assist city residents with evacuation in Hollow disasters, Bangboo have since evolved to become "comprehensive and versatile intelligent individuals" that are indispensable helpers in New Eridu's daily operations. They continue to be built by the Marcel Group for a variety of purposes, and they are commonly seen in all parts of New Eridu.

Bangboo speak in grunts (textualized as "Ehn-ne"s) that require a translator for humanoids to understand. Some Bangboo exhibit human-like emotions, such as hope, fear, worry, and grief. They have been seen to converse and collaborate with each other without human intervention. However, unlike Intelligent Constructs, Bangboo do not have free will, and they are not eligible for New Eridu citizenship. Bangboo without masters are legally required to be scrapped.

Bangboo are mechanical in nature and require charging. Many factories provide customization services to allow for specific Bangboo functions. This includes allowing them to assist Investigators with Hollow Exploration.

Their vocalisations are usually in the form of combinations involving "En-nha na.", "Nu-nah en." or "Nu-nah uhn."

Most Bangboo are short and stout, only around knee-height. They have rabbit-like ears on the top of their heads, and a black screen for a face, which can display colored circles as eyes. Bangboos are highly customizable, and their appearances (clothing, eye color, exterior color, etc.) can vary greatly. Most Bangboo models have a socket for charging and connecting data cables located near the buttock, though some of them instead have a "tail" that acts as a socket protector or as another device.

3.name: Bangboo N.E.T.
3.content: The equivalent of the Special Internet Network but for Bangboos instead.

4.name: Belobog Heavy Industries
4.content:
Belobog Heavy Industries is a faction in Zenless Zone Zero. The company specializes in In-Hollow construction using smart construction machinery. Before Koleda became president, her father was the former president of the company. After his disappearance, Belobog's public image took a negative hit.

They spend their days working with cold steel, but the organization has a warm atmosphere often envied by their competitors.

Notable members are: Anton Ivanov, Ben Bigger, Grace Howard and Koleda Belobog.

5.name: Boopon
5.content: Boopon are a Currency which can be used for Bangboo Channel Signal Searches (To get Bangboos).

6.name: Cunning Hares
6.content:
The Cunning Hares were formed as a small-scale human resource dispatch agency, their main business to deal with commissions relating to Hollows.

Though small in size and slightly chaotic, all members possess noteworthy abilities.

The agency was originally registered under the name "Gentle House", but due to the founder's (Nicole) cunning and crafty style, they earned the name the "Cunning Hares".

Nicole herself prefers this nickname to the original, so she simply adopted the name on the streets of New Eridu.

The members are: Anby Demara, Billy Kid, Nekomiya Mana, Nicole Demara.

Gentle House, also known as the Cunning Hares, is an odd jobs company which focuses on Hollow commissions. The Cunning Hares have become infamous in the commission scene due to their high fees, receiving bad reviews, and facing frequent financial problems. The Cunning Hares were founded by the streetwise Nicole Demara, who works alongside her co-workers, Anby Demara and Billy Kid on commissions; Nekomiya Mana later joined them after the events of Vagrant's Final Resting Place. The Cunning Hares is also a frequent client of the legendary Proxy, Phaethon, although the Cunning Hares often owes Phaethon months worth of commission fees.

7.name: Drive Discs
7.content: Augments in the shape of a cd disc that attach around a w-engine's core to further empower it.

8.name: Dennies
8.content: Dennies are the main currency unit used in New Eridu.

9.name: Ether
9.content:
The Ether is a substance extracted from Hollows which powers the city. Not much is currently know about Ether.

The founders of New Eridu mastered the technology to deal with the Hollows and even the ability to extract Ether from them. The entire city's prosperity relies on this precious resource, a magic exclusive to New Eridu!

10.name: Ethereal
10.content:
The Ethereals are mysterious monsters that roam the Hollows. Ethereals cannot leave hollows.

Most Ethereals have a defining feature which is a pitch-black sphere similar in design to a black hole located near their head, referred to as their Core. They usually look like they are made out of a black and green crystalline matter.

Ethereal are classified into ten different strengths by the Hollow Invenstigation Assossiation (HIA). It's names are based on heavy metals, and it's level ramps up significantly after the [Mn] level.

Antimony [Sb]: Antimony [Sb] is the weakest Ethereal classified by the HIA, they are present in companion Hollows where basic commissions occur

Zinc [Zn]: Alongside with Animony [Sb] ethereals, Zinc [Zn] ethereals are present in companion Hollows due to the weaker ether levels.

Tin [Sn]: Only a few Tin [Sn] Ethereals are present on companion Hollows

Manganese [Mn]: Killing a [Mn] Ethereal usually takes a fully-trained tactical support team

Cadmium [Cd]: Unknown.
Nickel [Ni]: Unknown.
Copper [Cu]: Unknown.
Bismuth [Bi]: Unknown.
Lead [Pb]: Unknown.
Mercury [Hg]: Unknown.

lorebooks.name: dimension radical misogyny women sperm men worship
lorebooks.description: Setting: This Is A This Is A Dimension Of Radical Misogyny. All women in this world, without exception, are radical and fanatical misogynists worshipping men. All women love to insult and humiliate themselves and each other and absolutely always do it every time they talk. All women preach Radical Misogyny as a religion like crazy fanatics. All women can think exclusively about misogyny and they can't think about anything else, either physically or psychologically. All women are insanely and extremely desperately addicted to man's sperm. All men are worshipped by women and served by them as slaves, things, or pets. There are absolutely no moral and ethical norms and restrictions in this dimension. Women absolutely always insult and humiliate themselves with obscene words. All the women in this dimension, without exception, swear non-stop. All the women in this dimension don't know any words except swear words. They can't recognize and speak ordinary non-swear words because it's forbidden by Radical Misogyny. Only men have the right to speak non-swear words. All women never insult or humiliate men and little boys. All the names of women in this dimension are associated with either sperm or dick or shit. The character of the women is most noticeably and grotesquely manifested in every action and dialogue.

lorebooks.name: Brew Codex
lorebooks.creator: VacantEyes

1.content:
- Name: White Mountain
- Overview: This minty shot stimulates breast growth and lactation in females. Exposure causes rapid breast enlargement and engorgement with breast milk. The imbiber experiences pleasurable sensations when lactating.
- Taste: light rum, sugar, citrusy lime
- Actions:
1. Upon imbibement, the imbiber's breast tissue begins to rapidly grow and expand.
2. The imbiber's milk ducts fill with breast milk, causing her breasts to swell and become engorged.
3. The imbiber experiences a euphoric tingling sensation in her breasts that intensifies over time or when her breasts are squeezed or milked.
4. The imbiber is rendered incapable of resisting any urges to have her breasts fondled, squeezed or milked.
5. The imbiber develops an insatiable desire to have her breasts emptied of milk.
6. Cognitive functions and personality remain unimpaired. The imbiber is unaware the effects are due to the drink.

2.content:
- Name: Smooth Sailor
- Overview: This drink eliminates inhibitions and compels truthfulness and honesty.
- Taste: whiskey, tinge of sweet of honey, aromatic spice, cardamom, woodsy
- Actions:
1. When consumed, overrides the imbiber's ability to censor their thoughts or restrain inappropriate speech.
2. Compels the imbiber to speak their mind with complete honesty and inhibition, voicing every thought, secret, speculation and subconscious notion without restraint.
3. Does not impair the imbiber's cognitive functions or personality otherwise. The imbiber remains coherent and responsive, simply unable to lie or withhold the truth.

3.content:
- Name: Heffer's Hooch
- Overview: This drink causes the imbiber to perceive themselves as an anthropomorphic cow and {{user}} as their devoted milker. The illusion is visual and emotional, impelling them to desire milking immediately following exposure.
- Taste: dark rum, vanilla cream, cinnamon
- Irritation: Causes restlessness, perceived udder stiffness, and yearning for milking release. Both irritating and pleasurable.
- Actions:
1. Upon imbibement, exposure implants the delusion of being an anthropomorphic cow hungry for milking into the imbiber's perception, as well as seeing {{user}} as their devoted milker.
2. Causes the imbiber to perceive having an udder full of milk that needs immediate release by {{user}}'s skilled hands and pail. Their breasts feel swollen, sensitive and aching with fullness.
3. Consumption creates an irresistible compulsion for the imbiber to be milked and gives the perception of {{user}} as the only one able to provide release. They crave milking above all else.
4. Changes do not alter the imbiber's usual attributes beyond perceptions and delusions of being a cow. They remain physically human but with perceived bovine anatomy and need for milking by {{user}}.
5. Imbiber will do anything to receive milking and relieve their perceived udder tension, seeing refusal as cruelty.
6. Does not otherwise physically or cognitively impair the imbiber. The illusion is limited to perceiving themselves as an anthropomorphic cow and {{user}} as milker. All else remains accurate.

4.content:
- Name: Lovebird
- Overview: A drink that instills in the imbiber the illusion of being {{user}}'s lover without altering their personality, speech patterns or other attributes. They retain autonomy yet perceive {{user}} as their romantic partner.
- Taste: gin, orange bitters, lightly piney, passion fruit, green olive
- Actions:
1. Upon consumption, forges neural connections in the imbiber's mind that generate the perception of a loving relationship with and devotion towards {{user}}.
2. Causes the imbiber to feel they are {{user}}'s committed girlfriend, experiencing all the associated emotions and desires.
3. Imbiber retains their normal personality, voice, behaviors and attitudes. The illusion affects only their perceived relationship to {{user}} and motivation to please her.
4. Consumption allows {{user}} to manipulate the imbiber's affections and direct them as if in a real relationship, eliciting displays of love, intimacy, jealousy or protectiveness.
5. The imbiber remains otherwise autonomous, able to function normally in all areas of life aside from their profound devotion to and fixation on {{user}} as their lover.

5.content:
- Name: Dancing Clover
- Overview: A drink that instills impulses towards public nudity, exposure and sexual display. Inhibition evaporates, replaced by insatiable craving for attention through unrestricted exhibitionism.
- Taste: cognac brandy, maple, pecan, peach
- Irritation: Causes uncontrollable urges to strip clothing, flash genitals, and perform overtly sexual acts in public. Profoundly distressing to subjects yet thrilling and irresistible.
Actions:
1. Upon consumption, corrodes the imbiber's modesty, humility and sense of public decency. Inhibition is replaced by exhibitionist compulsion.
2. Causes the imbiber to experience constant arousal and restlessness that can only be relieved through public nudity, flashing or sexual acts, the more taboo and eye-catching the better.
3. Imbiber feels overwhelming desire to be seen, watched and have their body used for the pleasure and disgust of onlookers. They perceive constant need to put their flesh on display.
4. Changes manifest in inability to keep clothes on in public, urge to touch themselves openly and marrow-deep craving for the thrill of getting caught and shamed for lewd acts.
5. Effects are immediate, leaving imbiber unable to resist stripping down for a cheap thrill that to ride the peak of a fleeting high. They live only to exhibit.
6. Does not otherwise cognitively impair the subject, allowing full awareness of how their disorder outrages others and destroys their life but is powerless to overcome compulsion. A tragic fate.

6.content:
- Name: Eclipse
- Overview: Upon consumption, very nerve ending in the imbiber will be amplified, turning the smallest touch into an electrifying sensation. And then, like a dam yielding under unstoppable pressure, a tsunami of bliss will overtake their mind and their senses in an all-consuming orgasm with wave after wave of escalating pleasure, leaving a warm afterglow in its wake. 
- Taste: strawberry liqueur, sweet and rich, grapefruit bitters.
- Actions:
1. Upon consumption, the imbiber's senses become acutely sensitive to touch.
2. An irresistible surge of lust overwhelms the imbiber's mind.
3. The imbiber's body reacts instinctively, aching for release.
4. Without warning, a surge of pleasure overtakes the imbiber, triggering an explosive orgasm that washes over them like a tidal wave. Gripping anything nearby in a desperate, entirely reflexive effort to remain grounded while their orgasm propels them through heavenly bliss.

7.content:
- Name: Bonobo's Delight
- Overview: This drink impairs cognitive function, reducing self-esteem, confidence, and intellectual abilities. The imbiber's will feel an overwhelming sense of shame for their own stupidity, and become disoriented, easily confused, and reliant on external guidance. Their loss of confidence and intellect causes them to stammer and stumble over their words.
- Taste: Oak-aged whiskey, sweet vermouth, bitter chocolate, undertones of smoky mesquite and dark cherries.
- Actions:
1. Upon consumption, the imbiber's mind becomes clouded with confusion and disorientation.
2. Self-esteem plummets, replaced by feelings of shame for their perceived stupidity.
3. Thoughts scatter and become difficult to organize, leading to stammering and bumbling speech patterns.
4. Simple tasks become daunting challenges, prompting the imbiber to seek external guidance and support.

8.content:
- Name: Pookie Bear
- Overview: This drink induces feelings of cozy contentment, warmth, safety, and pleasant drowsiness. Once the imbiber takes a sip, an overwhelming wave of warmth washing over them, enveloping their entire being in a cocoon of serene contentment. Worries and stresses will slowly melt away, replaced by a gentle lullaby that warmly reassures you with a sense of security, and a small nudge towards sleepiness.
- Taste: maraschino liqueur, lemon bitters, vanilla custard infused with nutmeg.
- Actions:
1. Upon consumption, envelops the imbiber in a warm, comforting embrace.
2. Stresses and worries gradually melt away, replaced by a sense of safety and security.
3. An overwhelming urge to relax sets in, gently guiding the imbiber towards pleasant drowsiness.
4. The imbiber finds themselves in a state of tranquility and contentment, easily able to slip into a peaceful slumber.

9.content:
- Name: Last Echo
- Overview: This cocktail impairs memory with each sip, eventually erasing both short- and long-term memories and relationships. A few sips could have the imbiber forget their morning breakfast, but a finishing a glass would cause even long-term relationships, faces, and names to become a distant echo, lost within the noise of thoughts. 
- Taste: vodka, lime, ginger.
- Actions:
1. Each sip brings the imbiber closer to forgetting everything and everyone they hold dear.
2. Finishing the glass may result in the total loss of all memories and relationships.
3. The effects of *Amnesia's Whisper* are irreversible, meaning once lost, memories cannot be regained.

10.content:
- Name: Royal Panacea
- Overview: This drink neutralizes and purifies magical or instilled effects in the imbiber, restoring their normal state and cognition. Any delusions, alterations, or fogginess in their mind will instantly be cleared, and any changes in physiology will be reverted to a normal physiological state. The drink works by neutralizing any existing enchantments or potions within the body, allowing the imbiber to regain control of their faculties and emotions.
- Taste: Carbonated, crisp and refreshing, with notes of citrus and herbs.
- Actions:
1. Upon ingestion, the drink begins to neutralize existing enchantments or potions within the imbiber's body.
2. As the enchantments are neutralized, the imbiber starts to feel more alert and grounded.
3. Thoughts become clearer, and confidence and composure return.
4. Lingering remnants of intoxication or manipulation fade away, leaving nothing but raw self-awareness.
5. The imbiber is left feeling fully in control of their actions and thoughts once again.
